text: Very disappointed and astonished to be told when we arrived  at 8:30 on a Saturday evening that the kitchen and the restaurant was closed for a private party.  We had looked at their website before going and there was no indication that they were closed that evening to the public; the hours they were open showed until 10:00 p.m. Saturday.  Been to many other ethnic restaurants in town which still serve the public when they also host private parties simultaneously!

Someone who read my comment may think that I am one of the friends of the restaurant owner. Actually, I am a friend of him now. How this happened? 
2 years ago, I came to Vegas for the first time and I was looking a Mediterranean restaurant. I found this restaurant on yelp. It was newly opened but the taste and quality of food was so delicious, so i had all my meals in MAZA during my vacation in Vegas. Also, the owner was so helpful and intimate that he gave information about Vegas, clubs and casinos. He even suggested some other restaurants from other cuisines. After this great taste experience, I came to Vegas 2 more times and on each of my trips, I went to MAZA to have my lunches and dinners. I also took my friends to MAZA, they were amazed by the great taste and hospitality. We were like in our home and had great time in MAZA. On the other hand, the employees are awesome! Jessica, the manager, she was very helpful and hosted perfectly when the Owner, Kamil was not in the restaurant. The cooker, Ege, he is an amazing young guy with great cooking talents. He cooked the kebab exactly as i wanted. The waitress, Lila and Serbian guy, they were smiling intimately, not insincerely. Ibo, the service guy, he even came to talk to us. And Kamil, the owner, he is an awesome, friendly, chatty guy.. I really enjoyed my conversations with him. In my last trip, I saw that they developed their business and they have new dishes in their new menu which the photos of each dishes. Also, the owner brought a another cooker from Turkey and started to serve pide and lahmacun which are my favorite fast food in Turkey and they go further and now they order a stone oven to cook pide and lahmacun.  Lastly, they use Halal meat which is important for me since I care my diet and health so much. Basically, MAZA Restaurant is a perfect place to have Turkish Mediterranean food. When you go there you have not only great food but also perfect friends. I strongly recommend you to go there. I wish they were here in Monterey, CA. Maybe, one day, they will.. ;)
This place is amazing Mediteranenan like what we found in Istanbul Turkey. Don't order another gyro, try try the real stuff like ground beef stuffed eggplant with rice pilaf and taziki. Amazing!!!!

Authentic. Hummus, bread and lentil soup were delicious! The eggplant and meat appetizer (don't remember the name) also delicious.  Our salad might have been missing some seasoning or dressing. Eggplant with ground beef entree seemed to lack flavor.
I love this place. The food is healthy....i wish you have brown rice to go with veggie kebab.

Delicious food!! Need I say more?  The staff are professional and friendly.  The portions are very large for the price point - go in hungry and you will still come out with leftovers.  Definitely a gem in the rough!  I would recommend it to friends, as well as come back next time I am in Vegas!!

We were told about this place by Marash ice cream parlor employee. I was looking for Turkish Shawarma with no luck until we visited Maza, my wife and I are very picky when it comes to food and service and Maza is a place to go when we are hungry. The food is thumbs up, service and cleanliness as well.

Food is authentic made out of quality ingredients. Nice, clean and peaceful atmosphere inside. Thanks Kamil and Alex for great food and hospitality. Very much appreciated. If you are in Las Vegas for a business trip, this is the place for Mediterranean food.
Türkiye'den bu kadar uzakta hem helal yemek lezzeti hem de tüm ortado?u lezzetlerini bulup sonras?nda türk kahvesi ve künefe ile taçlandirabileceginiz damak zevki için maza ..Te?ekkürler..

I know my Mediterranean food (Thanks to living considerable time in Petersen, NJ) and Maza food at the best was mediocre. We ordered couple of Combo Kabob & The food was flame burnt to give cooked look but lamb and chicken cube was absolutely not cooked at all in middle.

I prefer my meat medium to medium rare but both chicken and lamb were rushed fast flame broiled (dont know why, most of resturant was empty anyway).

To tip the experience off, they ring "automatic" 20% gratuity for a food which we didn't enjoy eating. Mind it, it was party of 2 and never I experience that you get to charge 20% gratuity on 2 people. I know it's groupon and supposed to be saving so shouldn't be big deal to pass it on to them, but tip is prerogative of customer based on service / food & I absolutely dont feel like tipping them 20% for this calibre of food.

I do not recommend this place to anyone; you are better off trying less expensive yet better food option in this cuisine type.
Amazing food and service. The waitress was really hospitable and we even got a free baklava. Loved it. The best Mediterranean food I ever had.

I've been eating here at least 1 or 5 times a month since I discovered this place back in Sept. of 2014. 

The chicken Kebab on rice pilaf is consistently delicious and on point every time. Sometimes the lamb is a bit chewy and the beef kind of tough, but both are still delicious. Just a little bit below the chicken Kebab for consistency. 

Service is always great, every portion of my meals has always been fresh. $10-16 for any of the Kebab's is money well spent. The Gyros are pretty good as well but I haven't ordered one in a while.. as you can tell, because I love the Kebabs!!!!!

Stinking bathroom. Never been to such restroom.
Very pathetic maintenance 
They took nearly 45min to get the food which is simple chicken adna kabob. I thought they are cooking fresh and as Yelp reviews are great I thought it would be great . But the food was awful . Chicken was like sponge . 
Even the waiters are lazy. Hardly respond . Very disappointed !!!
I ordered chicken shawarma and was cold, and without seasoning.  I told the server that the Shawarma was so could and she microwaved it!!!!  The place was noisy. The owner was singing!!

This place is great. We went just after what the normal lunch rush time would be. I had found a groupon for the restaurant. Since we were traveling, we figured why not try something different. Well, we got way more than we bargained for. We have the maza sampler to start which was stuffed grape leaves, hummus, a cucumber dill yougurt dip, and babaganoush (sp). It was served with a basket of fresh soft pita bread. These all had great flavor and textures to them. I ordered the chicken kabob and he got the sampler kabob. Both were large portions and came with pita bread and rice pilaf. Then our meal was rounded out with baklava and the offer of Turkish tea. We declined the tea and put our leftovers into a box for later. I almost forgot that we were also given a salad at the beginning of the meal. So, if you're really hungry or looking for some good fresh cooked food. This is the place to go. Reasonable prices and good friendly service.
It's one of the best restaurants here in the valley. A must try for all Mediterranean food lovers  good service as well.
Best Mediterranean food I ever tasted.. I used Eat24 app, this restaurant may have a high minimum when you order online but it's worth it!!!

We dined at Maza restaurant two weeks ago. We were a party of 9. We arrived 45 minutes before closing. Our host, Ana, was very nice, friendly, and professional. She went above and beyond to provide us with the best service, and the most pleasant experience. The food was extremely delicious. There Kinafeh was out of this world. The food preparation time between appetizers and entrees was quick. I loved the place, I recommend it, and it will definitely be at the top of my list when I visit Las Vegas again. Their food took me back to the good old lebanese days ;)

The food was amazing. The servers were prompt and courteous. Wait time for foot was very fast. We went and tried for a Groupon and found this gem. It's definitely a delicious place with a chill atmosphere for or all

Came here to visit my familiy. We have turkish restaurant in chandler,AZ. 

As a restaurant owner I enjoyed what i have order. 

Great food. Try iskender kebap. Complementary tea is good too.

We ordered 1 lb doner meat and kunefe for to go 

Thanks maza.
This is my third time at this location. The food was excellent and the service was great. Very friendly staff. Every visit has been fantastic.

Just finished a wonderful dinner here!  Never had Turkish food before.  Will be coming back soon!  The Kuru Fasulye a white bean and chopped lamb dish was delightful.   The Lentil soup was velvety smooth and seasoned perfectly.   Turkish baklava is softer and chewier than most others, not overly sweet.  MUST have the Turkish coffee with it!   Awesome.   Staff was friendly and welcoming.   I highly recommend it.  Like a mini Mediterranean vaca!
Wonderful service very delicious and healthy. . Very much recommend. . Food is amazin. Can't wait for the entertainment bon Saturday
This restaurant doesn't offer only Turkish food, but burger & buffalo wings too. Great for family & groups. Nice service, cleanness.
Wow. .. chicken can't be more moist. Lamb and rice is soooo good . Great staff and very fresh meats.

This was our first visit to Maza.  We were trying mediterranean food for the first time and it was quite a pleasant experience.  The hummus was the best along with the fresh hot bread that is comes with.  I was a bit hungry as I had a gryo (fantastic) and the seafood kabob.  My partner had the combo kabob that had beef , chicken and lamb.  The meats were very tasty in that you could tell that they were marinated and not just seasoned on the top of the meat.  We had the baklava for dessert and a surprise of turkish tea with it.  The tea was so good in that it required nothing like lemon or sugar in order to drink it.  We will defintley be back.
This place is fabulous. I have been to Turkey multiple times, and I can attest that the food here is the real deal -- wonderful flavors. I cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough.
We go there regular basis. Chicken kebab is the best! Hummus is great, baba goudis also great. Very friendly good service. Price is excellent.

Food and service was spectacular.. The only thing I was not satisfied is Turkish tea . It was not prepared right. It was too light and tasteless. Our server Costa was amazing. A true hospitality professional so kind and friendly. He deserves big kudos for making our visit great at this restaurant. 
Cheers,
Samet...

We found this wonderful place on Yelp tonight as our family was looking for Mediterranean food.  We live very close by and in fact drive by Maza almost daily.  Can not believe how great the food is and that we have never tried going.  We put in an online order, paid online and when we went to pick up the order was ready up front.  As other reviews stated the dining room is very pleasant so next time (soon) we will eat in the restaurant.  We had Chicken Kabobs, both chix breast and an order of ground.  The hummus was very fresh.  Salad crisp and everything was healthy.   Definite good find!

My wife and I went with friends on a Groupon and didn't know exactly what to expect but we were pleasantly surprised! The restaurant is one large room with tables and a few booths all decked out with white linen and butcher...definite Mediterranean feel. The tapas were excellent - I suggest getting the combo. The meals were varied and well priced. Exceptional flavors! We were all very impressed. We will definitely be going back!
Anna is amazing. Food was great and service was even better. Will definitely return. Anna gave us amazing recommendations for our meal and pointed out things to try on the next visit.

Amazing food! Super large portions!
Try the mixed grill and the mass appetizer platter
Wow!  Good food large portions!  Great prices!  The other restaurant that was here sucked.

Stopped here for lunch while getting my car serviced at a local dealership. The gyros are tasty, and my meal was served quickly. 

It's a nice quiet place to grab a bite to eat on a Saturday at lunch time. Absolutely no problem getting seated, and the waitress was attentive. I'll plan to be back soon.

This is our favorite Mediterranean restaurant..the food is always fresh,hot and delicious. We love the Beef kabob meal n also the chicken kabob lunch special... The humis is some if the best we ever tasted

I ordered Iskender kebab last night it has weird taste and made my stomach upset 
It was not good experience also it was over price
This place is my new favorite restaurant. The food was excellent, great service and very pretty inside. The kabobs and rice are the bomb. Please try it out, you will not be disappointed.
The food was delicious and service was exceptional. Our server, Leyla, was very helpful and super nice. We tried Kebap and it was well done. We will definitely stop by here whenever we are in town.

Really love this place.  Have been three times in the past month.  They welcome the Groupon coupon.  Waitresses are very sweet, particularly Alex.  I consistently order the Doner Beef Plate.  Piled high with thinly sliced meat, flavorful rice, salad and red cabbage.  My husband loves the chicken kabob.  The chicken kabob comes with a big bowl of salad.  He slurped (yes, probably more than you yelpers needed to know!) the salad dressing because it was just that good!  I hope that Las Vegans will frequent this business and help keep it afloat.

This is the best Turkish restaurant in the world i ate turkish food every where in the world This was the best experience I ever had.
The service is great their  hospitality was great by waitresses and waiters on top their food was the greatest food I've ever eaten in my whole life also the prices  were very reasonable. Every dish we ordered was awesome we were three families 18 people and everybody loved their food which is very rare in the restaurants.
I am  going tell all my friends and family to visit this place when ever they visit las  Vegas. 
4 thumbs us. Including my toes.
Great service, clean restaurant, very reasonably priced and their lamb kabobs are amazing. Gyros are great as well. Have been there several times, never disappointed once. Highly recommend.

Clean and very friendly staff. Very quite for dinner time, felt like the whole place is ours, and 2 other tables.  The kebabs were delicious, especially the beef kebab. Lots of meat and grilled perfectly to your liking. Lamb shank also looked good, my friend says it's good.  I don't eat lamb so can't judge myself. 

The salad was what draws me here from other Yelp photos, but unfortunately they don't look like that anymore. All the cucumbers and tomato goodness is now on a bed of boring shredded cabbage, unlike other photos on a bed of greens. So that's a bit disappointing. 

Pita was good but seemed store bought instead of home made like Khoury's. 

Think we will return because the meats are better than K's.

Went in for the first time for lunch. Clean and comfortable. Respectable number of patrons so figure its good. Service is friendly but a bit slow for lunch crowd that needs to get back to work.  White bean stew was good and hummus was really good and very fresh tasting. Made me eat more bread than I should.
This place is soo good the chicken kabobs are my favorite and the desert kanafe ( prob misspelled) is delicious mmmmmmmmmm

Went to Maza last night with my Turkish boyfriend. The food made him feel at home. He left full and so happy. Said it was the most genuine Turkish food he has had since he has been here. The Kuru Fasulye and Baba Ganoush were just 2 of his favorites, my favorite is of course the Baklava. We will be back for sure. Yummy!!!
Maza is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. Maza offers authentic Turkish and mediterranean dishes. I recommed trying doner-iskender, lahmacun, and pide-Turkish pizza.
Very good authentic Turkish food. Great service, very friendly stuff. Pleasant experience with friends. They have Turkish baklava, tea and origin Turkish coffee!
The plates were huge and the food was beyond delicious. Fast service and the waitress Alex was very helpful and nice. I am definitely coming back!

Loved the decor of the restaurant, a quaint place away from the strip. The overall experience was positive, pleasant attentive servers and excellent 
Food. We had the kabob sampler (chicken, beef and lamb) and the seafood kabob (salmon and shrimp), the chicken was juicy and delicious and the salmon was prepared perfectly. To finish the meal we had cheesecake and rice pudding, the rice pudding is worthy of return trip. Would highly recommend.
Very clean very good customer service. Very delicious food and very quick service...  They get  great Kinda and I love it

I 've been twice at this place and I have only good things to say about it . Friendly staff and owner with fast service. Original Turkish food with big generous portions and relatively good prices. Tasteful appetizers( ikra, sarma) and chicken kebab are among my favourite dishes . Although the  area and location  is not appealing , this restaurant  is worth your time. Would definitely be going again.

Have to admit that it was a coupon that lured us in. Why will we return again and again? The perfect service, outstanding food, and great menu pricing. Our favorites were the Ikra, Sarma, Tabbouleh, Chicken Shawarma, and Lamb Kabob.
Very good food. Very attentive service. I've been in twice and got take out once. Each time has been consistently good.

The food is full of flavor and amazingly good! We ordered the falafel and hummus for appetizers and the combo kabob and the rack of lamb for dinner. The waitress gave great service and filled our drinks. Come here if you want a taste for the Mediterranean!

Just tried Maza for the first time tonight... I'll have to make a second attempt at the coffee but the food was SO Good!! I had the chicken kabob with rice. The pita was so yummy and the side salad that came with was delish, I will definitely go back!!
Very nice, casual restaurant. Pleasant staff. Spotless. And the food is good. What more can you ask?  Our group of six were all pleased with the varied choices.

Delicious food and excellent service. Love this place!

We ordered hummus, sarma, beef kabob dinners. The flavors of the beef and rice are to die for. Thanks for the complementary Turkish tea.

Made a delivery order, BIG MISTAKE.  Food was pretty horrible and not correct.  All order changes were ignored and rice was for some reason changed to french fries that were inedible and soggy.  Pitas were still in the bag from the store.  STAY AWAY

Loved this Mediterranean food.!
Dished were beautiful and delicious.
The new owner came out too greet us and brought tea and rice for us to sample. Very friendly and youthful.
We came in the middle of the afternoon so it was a little quiet but filled up before we left.
Looks like they have luff music in the evenings.
We will definitely be back.

Cooking Turkish kabab and iskender is really hard job. Maza Mediterrian restaurant is doing this job very well :) I really like that. 

I ate iskender. Slice of meats are really delicious and of course with yoghurt and grilled tomatoes and pepper. 
Moreover the staff is really nice and kind :) they are very cheerful and helpful people. 

I will come again my second las vegas visiting.

Pffft...

If you haven't been here, you're missing out. 

Amazing food.  Amazing prices. 

An absolute gem.

We ordered from grub hub from Maza.  The delivery was very fast, but the food was awful.  We ordered the fish plate, and it consisted of tuna from a can, imitation crab salad, and lox.  I also ordered a pasta that came with some kind of oil that was inedible.  I have not dined at their restaurant, but do not order their takeout from grub hub.  At this point I am sure that I will not try dining in, as the food was disgusting.

I love this!! We have been to Vegas multiple times this year and we didn't really "try" to find a halal place. 

This is the halal spot we found and it is delicious!! We ordered through grub hub but when they came to deliver the food was still nice and warm, very tasty and they were really polite.

We will now have to go and eat in to see the service.

Los Angeles'ta Sofra Kebap'dan sonra Las Vegas'ta Buldu?umuz Helal Mekan... Gurbette ?skender Götürmek Fena De?ildi... Servis Falan Normal... Lo? Bir Ortam; San?r?m Özel Ak?am Yemekleriniz ?çin de Uygun...

I just was here today and as a Turkish descent i can say its almost better than any fancy restaurant in Turkey. I can say for America its really good. They have traditional Doner. Also you should try iskender kabob and Kunefe as a dessert.

The best mediterranean food in Vegas by so far, hands down. I ordered lamb shank and Mediterranean salad. It was the best lamb shank that I had in Vegas. I would suggest this place to everyone who has good taste for good Mediterranean food. I would defiantly retuning soon. 
Thank you

I did delivery today and it was so good. I went back and forth on what to order. Everything sounded so good. I tried the hummus, Mediterranean salad w/salmon, and the chicken shawarma. The fries were unbelievable!!! The hummus was great. Everything was soooo good. Delivery guy was nice. Menu is a keeper!!!

This was my first time trying to come here and eat with my husband on a Sunday night it's supposed to be a lounge as well but I don't understand if it's a legit restaurant why does it not notify yelp that they will be closed early just because it's Super Bowl and I had to drive about 45 minutes to get to this restaurant and see that it's closed because they did not inform yelp that they were closed very disappointed I haven't seen their food I haven't tasted their food I haven't seen their service but first look I'm very disappointed i'm not sure if I will return
SO tasty! Their rice alone is amazing, and the meat it comes with is just so good. They brought us tasty chopped salads before the entres. I'm so grateful for this halal option.

Here is quite big restaurant, we were there for Christmas time, they were really busy, crowded, thats way I can understand that whatever I ordered, they were out, then I just ate what my husband ordered. No soup, no Iskender... I think, staff was really tired because they even forgot to cancel the soup on our receipt, because they were out of the soup! Try not to seat close to door, because when it is opened, its freezing cold
The food here is amazing!! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Service is excellent!! Can't wait to come back!

Yes I am Born and raised in istanbul,Turkey. My kiddo is half Tr half Us. We all love the food here! Super delicious super healthy and clean. 
Helps us to ease the feeling of being homesick. I wish they have another location around The Strip or Henderson.

Very nice place. Food was excellent, we ordered the kabob combo, kofta, cicik, konafa and tea. Overall everything g was delicious well cooked and presented. My wife was happy .. i couldn't be happier!

Let me start with how hungry I was when I went to Maza to eat with my wife. The server came up to us and asked what we wanted. I ordered a beef kabob and my wife ordered a chicken kabob. I also asked for the vegetable kebab. 15 minutes passes and the served comes up and says, "Sorry, we don't have eggplant for the vegetable kabob, do you want it ?" We said No since there is no point of ordering a vegetable kabob with no eggplant. So
we waited and approximately 25-30 minutes later the server brings us a Chicken kabob plate for my wife. My wife did not start eating and just waited for my plate. Approximately 35 minutes later I ask the served how much longer do I have to wait for my beef kabob. The server says" its $9.95 and about 10 minutes." I told him that I don't care about the price and just wanted to know how long do I have to wait for my plate and he replied, "you didn't order anything." I told him that the first thing came out of my mouth was a beef kabob and he had that stupid look on his face. The server was from Serbia and his english was not good to understand I guess what we ordered. Let me tell you how the dirty that place was all kind of dust on the floor and chairs. The service was horrible, I asked for napkins and refill for my soda. My wife and I ended up splitting the chicken and it tasted bad, besides the portion was very small. I went to the bathroom to wash my hands prior to ordering and it smelled really bad. Try other places in town and don't waste your money please. I promise you will be disappointedworst restaurant in town.

Amazing food. If you are new to Mediterranean cuisine I recommend asking Anna the server. She was amazing and went out of her way to make it a memorable meal. Her knowledge of the cuisine is extensive.

Best bang for your buck lunch . Went here for lunch with my husband, we ordered the chicken Shwarma and chicken kabob . The lunch special is $9.99 and comes with a starter and a dessert . As a starter we both ordered the salad - the veggies were delicious and crispy , the only thing we could say was we wish the dressing had more flavor .. It seemed to be just oil and was missing the vinegar and tartness that is common in Mediterranean salads . Our chicken plates were delicious ! We also upgraded to fries and they were very tasty ! For dessert we ordered the rice pudding & baklava - both came with a delicious Turkish tea to finish it all ... Very delicious deal . 

Note : lunch specials end at 3pm !
The best Turkish food I have ever had.. Their chicken Adana is amazing.. Try their lunch specials-So good :)

My husband and I were looking for a Turkish restaurant and we stumbled upon this gem during our vacation in Vegas. Our waiter gave us great service with great conversation. Their lunch special is a great deal with soup, main dish, and dessert. We actually dine-in twice and will definitely go back when we're in Las Vegas!
We had really good time . Food , drinks, music all were perfect for price. We had shish kebab,  salads,  kunefe all were delicious.  Service was great. Higley suggested.

Food was excellent, meat was tender with great flavor Although the salad needs to add a bit of salt. One less star for the service..but overall a good experience at this establishment. Will return if I crave this region food.

Amazing food and great service!! 
This place has the best Turkish food in town, although at the beginning I wasn't sure what to order my waitress was very helpful in helping me decide. I recommend this place if you are looking for great Mediterranean food, and a good family atmosphere!

Very good food. Server was attentive.  I had the Doner Beef Kabob; preparation and presentation were excellent.  Decor is very well done and the restaurant is spotless.  With a shared appetizer and two entrées the bill was around $45.  A little expensive for me for lunch but it is a good treat.
Tasty food. Fresh salad. Highly recommend. I once went 3 days in a row. Did I mention the salad is delicious.

Disappointing food and service.

Took 30 minutes for falafel and hummus and it wasn't even that busy. While sitting around and waiting for them, never did they once even bother to update us on the status. I had to ask numerous times and different people to check.

Finally when the food arrived, I knew theyd forget the coffee so I had to remind them of course.

When it got down to eating, the hummus was some of the blandest hummus I've ever had. The Falafel were just thrown into a box like they had just been scooped from the road outside.

Coffee was fine.
Bread was good.

Never coming back to eat here and probably won't be having any Mediterranean food for a while.

Good food and good service! Came here with a groupon and the family and was not disappointed! Tr kebabs were grilled perfectly and the side dishes that the entrees came with were great. The salad was cool and refreshing. We will be back for sure.

Went to lunch here on a Saturday. It's in the plaza corner of Sahara and rainbow. We seated ourselves. Host is polite and greeted us gave us menu. Not too crowded. Great food. No long wait.Ordered the chicken shawarma plate with fries. Flavorful and fries aren't greasy or soggy so thumbs up!  Pleasant and relaxing place to eat & chitchat. They accept cards, and cash.
First and best Turkish food in Vegas. Love the place and environment. Very friendly and nice staff. I am just loving this restaurant. Make sure to try Manti. It is great!

Randomly felt like ME food after talking about King's in Washington DC with a friend, picked this place just going off the selection of sides with a meal. Best choice for food in months.

Got the chicken kabob with rice, fresh salad and grilled veggies and my friend got the hummus, extra pita and chicken wrap --- insane how great the kabob was dipped in cucumber yogurt, hummus was fresh and flavor was great. Portions are large, food is filling and you get that 'healthy' feel only great food gives you.

One co-worker tried a piece, immediately cancelled his dinner plans and stayed late to get an order -- this is the only places in years I stopped eating just to share the food with others because I found it so good.

I really like this joint and heartily recommend it. 

The only ding I can place against Maza is it isn't magically appearing right now in front of me.

This is a great find in Vegas! We came here for the first time and had such a pleasant experience. The food was super fresh and healthy, great spices and I loved the Turkish tea! The lamb chops were so tender and tasty. The atmosphere is trendy, clean, and they have live music on the weekends. My new favorite spot in Vegas.
Leaves more to be desired. Food is bland and ranks low in comparison to other Mediterranean food I've had. Delivery service was punctual.

I've spent time in Turkey and I was really craving some lentil soup and an Iksender kabab. I found Maza online via Yelp and thought I would give it a try. I was pleasantly surprised! The lentil soup was perfect (not too thick) and the Iksender kabab was super delish! The atmosphere was nice and the service was great. I will most certainly be back for some authentic Turkish cuisine!!
I have been 3 times , this is really good Mediterranean restaurant. I m waiting next vacation at Las Vegas. I will go to eat there again.

Wow. Probably the tastiest kebab I've ever eaten.

The seafood kebab comes with juicy lump of salmon and flavorful grilled shrimp, as well as the shiny grains of rice and grilled tomato and chili. The tomato-based dipping sauce has intricate but not overpowering flavor that complements the simplicity of grilled stuff.

Tried both lamb and beef, and while both were really good, lamb will remain as our fix. Hummus was great, too.

But I cannot end this review without mentioning the most surprising find: Baklava.

Whenever we tried baklava in the past, it was always too sweet to the point that caused a headache. We never liked it. But as this place offered baklava as a check-in bonus, we decided to try on a whim - and glad we did! The baklava had a delicate sweetness and texture, and the flavor of ground pistachio completed the traditional Turkish pastry. Also, we ordered a couple of chai - comes in the traditional cute little cup - at no charge!

One major letdown was that the both times we visited, the table cloth was not clean, and the paper table cover didn't fit with the shape of the table in a booth, and kept making friction noise all the time. Interior design could use some sprucing up.

When those issues are solved, I can give them five stars!
food was decent and service was great! friendly staff and good pricing (-: first time at a greek restuarant, i wouldnt mind coming back.

Absolutely delicious and fresh food. I went with a company of five people for dinner.  The place has a very nice and a pleasant atmosphere. The waitress was very professional and courteous. We shared four appetizers, hummus, babaganoge, pickled vegetables and falafel. I ordered the combo chicken and beef kabobs (the ground meat on skewers ) and it was excellent.

amazing quality
reasonable price
The interior is not very luxurious but obviously the food is what matters which was one of the best middle eastern foods Ive had in a while

Great service, very attentive especially since there was only one waitress, she did a great job.  Try the Chicken kebabs, very flavorful and moist.  Rice pilaf is great here as well.  Cucumber salad was very tasty.

Food was amazing. We had the seafood kabob and the lamb kabob, some of the best food we had in Vegas. Get the Groupon for the meza sampler, 2 entrees and 2 baklava pastries. You can't go wrong with coming here unless you really just don't like this type of food, but worth trying.

Lots of Mediterranean places have popped up in this space: Opa, Plaka, and now Maza. New ownership, interior has had a face lift, cool bar area but no alcohol available yet. Menu mentions $7 lunch specials but I did not see any advertised. 

Ordered the chicken shwarma sandwich with rice, $10- hostess/server gave me a heads up that the dish "isn't really a shwarma, it's made in a pan". Decided to give it a try anyway, and the meat and seasonings are okay but it was served, inexplicably, in a giant hoagie bun. When I am at a Mediterranean restaurant, I expect a sandwich to come on pita or lavash, this bun was way too much bread! 
The meat was of okay quality but sandwich was not served with any sort of sauce, just peppers, onions, and tomato, which gave the dish almost a fajita feel.
Option of rice or fries for my side, picked the rice, which was warm and soft, but after eating the sandwich breading, I couldn't take any more carbs.

Note that they have discount deals up on Yelp and Groupon, and a Yelp check in offer for a free piece of baklava, which was honored even for my take-out order.

I had a great experience in this restaurant. Food was authentic Turkish food, service  was so fast and professional and they had home made baklava and sarma. If you are in Las Vegas and looking for a Turkish-Mediterranean restaurant try this place.

Love this place!!! The atmosphere is great, place is clean and well decorated.. But the best part is the food it's affordable, delicious, and the portions are big.
 Next time you ain't know where to go for lunch or dinner try this place you are going to love it too.. And try the combo cabob or the rack of lamb they were my favorite!

Very nice place to experience eastern mediterranean food.  Extensive menu and nice cozy environment.  Unlimited pita bread and complimentary tea was a nice touch.  The chicken shishkabob was very good.  Nice attentive service.  Will be back for more

This food is so bomb I had to write a review! I had the seafood kabab and everything was grilled perfectly and the rice is so flavorful! I also got the Sigara Borek and they are so delicious! Sarma was pretty great too. Will def be ordering here again, despite the higher delivery min!

I loved this place. The service is very friendly and the food is awesome. One of my colleagues recommended this restaurant to me and I took my fiance for dinner here. We ordered Ezme and lentil soup as starter items. They were delicious, especially the Ezme. It tasted fresh and unlike anything I've ever had. For the meal I got beef and lamb kabob shish kabob combo plate. The meats perfectly cooked and marinated. The red sauce they served with the entree complimented the meats. The entree also came with side salad, which was ok. All the meats are halal friendly. The meal was delicious and relatively cheap. I highly recommend this place.

Great food! Their rice and chicken kabob were excellent! I love that they serve Turkish coffee in actual Turkish coffee cups. This is a great place to eat and the prices were very reasonable. The service was friendly and accommodating and the owner even came by and chatted with us for several minutes. I will definitely be back and will recommend Maza to my friends.
Great food, excellent service the owner makes you feel at home. My favorite is the lamb chops and chicken and beef adana kabob..yummy

I have a current obsession with Mediterranean food. I purposely look on yelp, and drive all over Las Vegas looking for awesome Mediterranean places (whether it'd be Greek/Persian/Lebanese) and I was really impressed with Maza! My boyfriend and I ordered Esme, Lebni, and Hummus to share and we loved everything. The server/hostess/superwoman was very nice to let us try Ikra (eggplant dip) and it was so good. For the entrees, we both got the combo kabob platter which was perfectly marinated and the meats were so tender and juicy and the vermicelli rice that came with it was delicious, as well (salad was okay). The food overall felt authentic. I usually don't care enough about places to write reviews because A) I am selfish and just care about putting food in my mouth and B) most places are MEH. But this place has only been open for two weeks and I am so glad that it did and hope it gets busy and stays open!

We came here because we have never been to a Turkish restaurant in Vegas. We walked in and immediately were greeted by the friendliest server in all of Vegas! Aleks! We knew immediately it was going to be a good meal, and we were right - the food is very very tasty and with large portions. The highlight of the meal was the homemade Baklava - so delicious! They give you free Turkish tea afterwards and we will definitely be back soon for more food and fun!
Amazing place. Turkish food is good by itself and this place adds more value on it. Definitely try this place.
everything was good they have halal meet and we love it  .perfect salad and soup   very nice
I eat here for lunch often. The food has always been well above expectations. Take advantage of the lunch specials, a large amount of quality foods for a very affordable price.

I ordered the food through grub hub. Although it took a while to arrive because I live far from the restaurant, I absolutely LOVED the food. It's to die for! They forgot my drink so I called back and told them if they were still close, they could bring it, if not it wasn't a problem. Since they have forgotten my drink, they went to a store near by, got me a drink and came back. 

They are not afraid to make the extra step that will make the experience just wonderful! I'm eating the left overs now and I'm sad there's no more 

Incredible food and very friendly staff! Thank you. Will come back!
Excellent service and food. We had the Beef Doner and the Beef Shawarma. Nice atmosphere, good ambience. Try it!!
We were pleasantly surprised. The food was authentic Turkish. Everything was delicious.  The staff was welcoming and friendly.

The food at this establishment is so good it's ridiculous!  I would not be able to come up with a single complaint except maybe it's not close enough to where we live.  I came in with my husband and 2 daughters.  The waitress greeted us the minute we stepped in the door and luckily she was our waitress for the night.  She was formal (like they are in fancy restaurants)  but not one bit stuffy.  She helped us with ordering (the kebobs are to die for! as is the sampler plate!)  The presentation was along the lines of a 4 star restaurant.  She brought us complimentary Turkish tea at the conclusion of our meal which was wonderful!  We will definitely go back again.  I also think this would make a great event restaurant as they offer platters for 8 or more people.  Prices are very reasonable for what you get!
Everything was good EXCEPT the chicken. I'm fairly certain the chicken was not thoroughly cooked. Slightly disappointed. Only good thing was the discount from Bitesquad.

Very good place, especially for their $9.95 lunch special. There's a good variety to choose from for your special, and the desserts are quite good. I love their rice pudding. If you're not a carb counter, they give you plenty of bread to munch on and complimentary Turkish Tea (not sure if this is a limted time thing). Love the food and love the service.

Delicious food, good vibes, fantastic service.  I love coming here to catch up with friends while munching on different items on their menu.  Appetizers are great, I especially like their baba ghanoush.  Lamb chops are the bomb, I pretty much get it everytime I go.  I will then get kunefe and Turkish coffee to finish the meal.  One of my favorite restaurants around the neighborhood for sure.

Got carryout a few times over the last 6 months and the quality keeps declining. Today was the last and final time I'll be going back. The chicken Adana kebob had no flavor, was barely grilled and tasted like it was mostly bread crumb filler. The chicken soup looked like it was made with frozen vegetables, was all dark meat, and was a bit bland. The rice lacked texture. The only thing that was edible was the pita bread but it was not even made in the restaurant. 

The place is s bit depressing looking which is why i only get takeout. 

Too many other good kebob options nearby to come back.

Last three times I came here I was disappointed so I really don't know why I decided to give it another try, wishful thinking I guess. 
The lentil soup was too salty but not so bad. I had the Adana Kebab. It had no flavor, tasted like kofte more than it did kebab. My husband had chicken kebab, didn't have any flavor to it either. They never brought us side salad that we were supposed to get with our meal. We actually ordered coban salad, they never brought that to us either. When I reminded the waitress that we had ordered salad, she offered to bring it but we were almost done with our meal so I didn't want a whole salad. I was still super hungry since the meal wasn't good at all so I asked if she could bring me a small coban salad. She said she can bring a small house salad (that we were supposed to have gotten anyway) The salad she brought tasted like wet lettuce. It was so bad. I asked for some dressing thinking it'll help with the taste, the dressing she brought us was just oil. So, all in all everything we ordered was HORRIBLE. There were only 4 other small tables occupied with 3 waiters/waitresses working so there is NO excuse for the bad service. It's safe to say, I will definitely not be going back. Do yourself a favor and just order some Pizza Hut or something.
This stuff is amazing! Even salad, pita bread and rice has extremely flavorful and good quality ingredients!

First, I take my Mediterranean food seriously, I never thought that Mona's (NewOrleans) would be replaced as my number one favorite spot, but alas MAZA is NUMBER ONE. Not only was the service great but the food was OFF THE CHAIN. We ordered the Sarma which was delicious. The chicken shawarma was a medley of flavor (add feta) the veggies crisp, meat seasoned like no other. I can't remember my hubby's order but it was deleicious too. The kids burgers were crazy thick, I kid you not...cooked they were still 1/2 inch thick patty. I will be back ASAP. Probably tonite for shawarma. Don't be like me, passing it daily thinking "I wonder if they are good?" They Are!!!!
It's Turkish cuisine but definitely not Turkish prepared. Service was great and our server was knowledgeable but food is far from "best Turkish food" as it states.

Went here for lunch last week, and enjoyed a great meal. 

We got the hummus sampler, it came with pita.

I ordered the chicken adana lunch special. I ordered it with falafels, and maklava. I don't eat much medetterranian food but this was very good! Everything was very well prepared and tasted very authentic.

After we ate I ordered a Turkish coffee, it was very strong and was everything I would expect from Turkish coffee, I didn't really enjoy the coffee grinds in the bottom of the cup but it didn't really upset me.

The waiting staff was very friendly but seemed over worked and a it showed. This is a great place I would recommend coming here if you're on that side of town.

This is my fourth time here, and every time food has been consistently deliscious. The waitresses are low key, genuine and friendly. Owner tries to reach out to most tables and ensure everything is okay. Food is 5 star really tasty, presentable and nicely sized portions. Loved the combo kebab, Mediterranean salad, and Karni yar?k. I even got cheap enough to check in on yelp and claimed a baklava. Will go again and recommend highly.
Great good and service. Just moved from New York City and was hoping to find a great Mediterranean restaurant. Little out of the way, but worth it. Damla was amazing.
I drive across town for the Shepard salad with house dressing. THE BEST!

The food was good and we will return.  However, service is an issue here.  We had to ask for every drink refill (including water) and our table of four had our food delivered one dish at a time with long waits in between.  We all ordered the same item and diner #1 was almost finished eating by the time diner #4 received his food.  It was annoying and uncomfortable.

Just ordered a gyro and falafel's to be delivered from ubereat's. The most amazing gyro meat thinly shaved loaded with flavor and the taziki sauce you can tell is made in house fresh!! Falafels were flavor packed with a side of creamy humus. This place is definitely on the top of my list!

About 5 miles away from the strip. Like other reviews have mentioned, this place is not very busy at all. But it should be. The food is outstanding, very tasty and a great option if you like Turkish or middle eastern food. The quality of the meat and seafood was excellent. Great service as well. I recommend escaping the strip for a quiet dinner here that will satisfy your palate.

Excellent food and service. The Adana kabob was  delicious as was the salad and appetizers. And baklava.was to die for ..There was 5 if us in the party
And all was happy after we ate dinner..

Before I read the reviews, I was so excited to eat here.. Then after reading some of the reviews? I was a little nervous. I just finished eating here and MAN! Amazing... I ordered the lamb kebab. So amazing!! The Greek salad was incredible... Our service was fast also. So happy to find another great Mediterranean restaurant right down the street from my house. Thank you for the amazing food and service!!

The food is on the better end of average but the service is ungodly slow. I called in an order, they said it would be ready at 1220 it's is now almost 1. I'm about to have to just leave bc my lunch hour will be up before I get my food.

Update: Still waiting 1:10

Wow!! I absolutely loved loved this place! If you're staying on the strip it'll take about 20 min to get to this restaurant by cab or limo. It is located outside of the strip. It's simply the best Mediterranean restaurant I've dined at. Arriving here I was a little disappointed to learn they do not have their liquor license but if we wanted to they said we could get it from a nearby store and they'd be happy to serve it. This was quickly forgotten once the food came out. It was a lot of us and we literally ordered everything on the menu!!! It was so good that it was hours before we were ready to leave. 

I highly recommend getting everything!! The next time I'm in Vegas this will be where I'll go. Oh and the pricing is just unbeatable!!
The best Chicken kabobs, rice and salad. The food is always fresh, hot and the servers are friendly and willing to please. They have a great Groupon offer.

Not so good.   The falafel was pasty. Humus was decent.  I ordered the lamb shank thinking it would be tender and juicy,  braised all day in a special sauce.  Boy was I wrong.  It was so dried out and had lost all it's flavor.  The left overs will feed my puppy. Spend your money somewhere else.

Very nice and authentic Turkish food. One of the best I had outside of Turkey! I went with the family for lunch and tried Ikra, Iskender kebab and Beyti Kebab. They all tasted excellent. The service was very prompt and professional. Their Ayran and bread were nice and authentic as well. I would go back for sure.

(Ordered online, so I don't actually know anything about the physical restaurant.)

The baklava was absolutely divine. It was so sweet and flaky, the flavor is just incredible. The gyro sandwich was a little disappointing. The meat was burnt and a bit too oily. The lamb kabob entree was very good. The lamb meat was excellent, it really complimented well with the rice, pita bread, and salad (the only mediocre portion out of the whole entree). 

Overall a bit pricy, but delicious.
Great service & great food. Took the family & they were very accommodating for us. Will be back to try more.

The food was authentic, delicious, and the service was wonderful. Lilia paid very close attention to our needs throughout the meal. After the meal, we were served complimentary Turkish tea. I would love to come back to this place after the wonderful first experience.

I absolutely LOVED this place! Today was my first time visiting and the waiter (a very tall handsome male),treated me and [my] family as though we were [his] family
The women there are exceptional cooks for starters and we pretty much sampled everything from appetizers down to the ice cream & Turkish coffee. I must admit,there was absolutely nothing  to complain about! Unless of course you're that negative bitter lonely individual who enjoys putting others down or simply finding trivial reasons to be unhappy. I highly recommend this place and will be returning soon for that good ole baklava

Adana and hunkar begendi was great. However, we did not like shawarma. It would be better than expected. That is why my review is 4 stars. The place was clean and they provide high chair and crayons for your children. If I had chance, I would like to go, and eat Adana again.

I bought this Groupon for $62 ( reg. $95.58)  meal for 4 people and it's  all worth it!!! First we started with a 2 maza sampler, fresh warm pita bread with 3 different kinds of dips, so yummy . Then we had the salad that is very fresh, never had that kind before but I can't complain, it was good. After that entree was served ( see photo ) every item we ordered was very tasty especially the beef kabob but truly overall, everything was delicious!!! Lastly to complete the meal, baklava & hot tea compliments the whole deal, our first experience to eat Mediterranean food was phenomenal!!! The only bill i got was just the soda we ordered & of course I gave a generous tip for a wonderful service & excellent meal! We would love to come back here again especially my kids whose normally hard to please when it comes to food but they couldn't wait to come  back here again & try the other items on their menu. Best visit ever!

Extremely average Turkish/Mediterranean Food. Even for the US !!!
Don't expect anything special or delicious.
The Russian Waitress was nice.

Just ordered a beef shawarma and chicken shawarma with fried falafels and I am NOT happy with my order. I work literally 1 mile down the road and it takes the delivery driver almost a full hour to bring cold, soggy shawarmas and soggy fries. If i knew it was going to take him that long, i would have picked up the order myself. I dont even want to eat lunch now and I've been starving. I am 6 months pregnant, who has been craving shawarmas and shouldn't be deprived of my cravings because of service. I even called the restaurant 30 mins after ordering, asking about my order and they couldnt even find my order. Then all of a sudden says, "oh, its on its way. He should be there shortly" another 30 mins goes by... and yes i have my order, but now its cold and disgusting. Horrible Service. I will NOT be ordering from them again. So disappointed.

Meh service and meh food. I got the hummus for an appetizer, the Mediterranean salad with salmon for an entree while my brother got the chicken and mushroom Alfredo for his entree. The hummus was nothing special and the Mediterranean salad was alright. The salmon was fantastic though. Blackened the way I like it. My brother was upset with his pasta because it had red pepper flakes which was not stated on the menu (maybe it was and we don't remember though) it also had literally two slices of mushroom. It shouldn't be called the chicken and mushroom pasta if there are barely going to be any mushrooms in it. My salad also was missing the kalamata olives it was stated to have come with. The service was really just blah. The waitress was nice enough but she brought me the wrong iced tea (raspberry) at first and also my salad came out about 5 minutes after my brother's food. Which doesn't sound like a long time but it is when the person is waiting for you to get your food and there's is getting cold. The last thing was there was no one on the floor for periods of time. There should always be someone watching the dining room. Definitely never coming back here.
Real good service warm people and great food We loved this place! We have been looking Middle eastern  food and this was real good choice!

First time eating here for lunch today and ended up loving it.  Lunch specials were an amazing deal and so much food. The staff was very friendly as well.  Happy all my co-workers ended up loving it as well, even though one of them was confused and ended up ordering a head wrap instead of baklava ;-)  we will be back for sure.

Some of the best chicken & jasmine rice I've ever had! Both of us loved our meals and all of the staff was very friendly. There was a large graduation party dining at the same time as us- over 20 people plus children- and they seemed short staffed but we're on top of everything.

Excellent food. Probably one of the best restaurants I've been to in Las Vegas. I've had sushi, thai and american so far, and Maza was the best by far. Damla was a very good server, got our orders right and prepared out checks exactly how we asked (we simply asked for separate checks) and was very polite. I highly recommend this place. The food was delicious and flavorful. Our food came out very quickly even though the place was pretty packed.

The food here is delicious. I tried two entrees, one was the combo kabob and the other was the lamb shank. Both were really tasty and the lamb shank was so tender.

The only reason I took one star off was for the service. The service is slow and could be better.

Went here with one of my best friends, who is from Ankara, Turkey.  I spent some time in Turkey as well so we were both excited to have Turkish food in Vegas finally....since it's our favorite.  Her boyfriend joined us as a first-timer for this cuisine.  We ordered three entrees, the Manti (Turkish Ravioli), Iskender Kebab and the white beans with meat (forgot the name).  We had lentil soup and the choban salad as appetizers and then for dessert, turkish tea, kunefe and baklava.  Almost all was fantastic; my friends stated that the baklava was the only weak part of the meal.  Her boyfriend loved all the food, even as a first timer and one who grew up with a very American diet.  She stated they plan to come here every week now.  I'll definitely be back as well.  Service was fine; nothing extraordinary and never got a refill on our waters....but the meal was what shined.

After a long training session I was tired, and my fridge was completely empty. I was in no mood to go out anywhere, so I stumbled across Maza on DoorDash and it looked solid. The fact I didn't have to move a muscle was a big plus, lol.

I ordered the combo platter that comes with chicken and beef kabob, french fries, pita, onions, roasted tomato, and salad. The delivery was quick and my order came as requested. The portion size was reasonable for the price, and they also packed utensils and condiments.

However, it wasn't a great meal. They put everything in a Styrofoam box, so the french fries were completely soggy (I wish more restaurants would use paper bags for fried foods that allows foods to stay crispy). The beef was over cooked to well done (site says they do medium well). 

Flavors were good, but overall I would say it is just average. I was hoping for a more exceptional meal.

This place is so delicious and the service was impeccable.  I was so impressed.  Their house salad was so fresh and delicious as were their grape leaves appetizer (my fav!)The lamb kabobs literally melt in your mouth.

I loooooooved this place! Found this place on Yelp and decided to give it a try! I'm Iranian and very critical of any kind of kabobs but I have to say this place is amazing! The meat was very tender and delicious and comes with a good size salad! 

Turkish coffee was really good 

Also loved that they had complementary Turkish coffee to try after the meal!

My G/f and I stopped in here for lunch. We had the ground chicken kebab and the steak kebab both of which we thought were pretty good. In fact the ground chicken kebab was probably the best I've had. I also really liked the hummus and the tomato cucumber salad. They could however ease up on the herbs in this salad but it's pretty good. 

The atmosphere is a bit more upscale than you would normally expect for a kebab joint but the cost doesn't really reflect it that much. The service is better than most places I've been with similar food. I really like to support our local businesses in Las Vegas as we are also business owners. I really look forward to going back here for dinner when they add the entertainment and get their liquor license. Food good service good price point is affordable. I think this place will make it and it will be a good spot to spend the evenings. I highly reccomend!

If I could give this place 10 stars I would!!!! Always so good and consistent. The food is ahhhmazing and the staff are great too. Chicken kabob, sultans delight, lentil soup, and the rice pudding are the best things to order here.

After a great experience the first time we retuned and had another wonderful meal. Our server Leyla was very attentive and again our meal was very tasty. This place is a must visit for anyone looking for authentic Turkish/Mediterranean  cuisine in Las Vegas. Worth a cab ride if you are on the strip or order take out.

My second time at MAZA in 2 days! 

The SEAFOOD KEBAB is my favorite!  It come with SHRIMP & SALMON grilled, a side of veggies, and salad & PITA of course! 

The staff is very friendly and it has a dimly lit setting. I'm assuming to provide romance! They play soft music in the background which is nice and there's a fish tank near the kitchen. There's plenty of parking out front and it is on a major intersection. The food is fairly priced. 

Definitely will come here again! I will add photos of the food next time, since it was way too good for me to hold off and take photos for you all!

I will make this Quick and simple. Really Healthy and great food. I have been to many places oversees and this was absolutely spot on in flavor and presentation! We will definately be going again.

Oh and i will say they absolutely have the best baklava  hands down in town in my opinion!

We came to Maza on a Groupon. Wow was it worth it!  Fantastic baba ghanoush, and hummus. My husband says the stuffed grape leaves are the best he's ever had. The food was well spiced, but not spicy. The meat was very tender and flavorful. This food is simple yet very satisfying. Just looking at the plate made me feel healthy and happy.  We are looking forward to coming back and bringing anyone that loves good food!  Have read some negative reviews and don't know where they are coming from. We were very well treated by both our server and waitress and the food was really good. Maza is a great place.

This is one of my parents' favorite restaurants. I've been here three times in 2 months. We bought the meal- which included salad, a generous spread of pita bread, hummus, baba ganoush, muhamarrah, tzatziki, stuffed grape leaves. The muhamarrah was the best I've ever had! Next was the main course of rice, red onion pickles and kabob. The steak and chicken kabobs were cooked perfectly. 

Meal ends with hot tea and baklava with pistachios. 

There's so much food you'll be sure to take some home. It's quite a feast! 

Tip- ask the server politely to make sure the meats aren't overcooked. The second time we came here the meats were slightly overcooked. 

This is a family owned restaurant. When we were here they didn't serve alcohol, but call and ask. Perhaps you can byo. 

Tonight, there's a singer on stage - lots of dancing and fun Turkish music. It's like a party here tonight!
Good food, kind and prompt service! I really like this restaurant and visit it at least twice a month.
Not real good.  Ordered a gyro with fries and tabouli.  Gyro meat tasted old and tabouli wasn't much better.  Won't be back with so many great choices, one is right down the street on Sahara.

Just ate the swarama here! Really like it :) the service was some of the best I have ever experienced, I felt very attended too! I would highly recommend it to anyone. The price was reasonable mainly because the service was so good!
excellent food - kebabs were tasty and the food is fresh. dont miss out on the turkish coffee as well. would visit again!

My husband, daughter, and I came here on a whim but were pleasantly surprised by the great selection, friendly staff, and mellow atmosphere. 

We ordered the Cacik and Falafel with pita and hummus for our appetizers, and Karniyarik and Kofte for the entrees.  The kofte came with a delicious salad that had a vinegar/lemon flavor. The kofte and falafel were just right (not dry) and all the food had the right amount seasoning.  

It looks like they might have nightly entertainment, but we were a bit early for any of the festivities. We'll definitely be back.

This is the first Mediterranean/ Turkish restaurant I've been to and it was great. A previous review suggested the seafood kebab, which I got and it was fabulous. I usually don't like shrimp but this place really perfected seasoning and preparing of shrimp. If you get anything get the seafood kebab. This kebab came with a salad which I thought was a bit bland but if you're on a salt cleanse it's great. 
Also I'm a hummus lover and this place has some gooooooood hummus.
Their baklava is great, a tad bit on the oily side though.

Amazing food. True mediterranean food and you won't be disappointed. The meat is so tender and their selections is big. Don't worry if you have to wait a little because it's worth it. And it's better to wait since it means they are busy and people love their food. Great Job on this great restaurant and thank you for the experiences each time I went.

Wasn't impressed. I was craving for Mediterranean food after church and because it was super close to church, we came here for lunch. It wasn't busy so we were seated immediately. The place was dark and in my opinion was unkempt. There were chairs stacked up and stored in random places. It didn't look like they were renovating. Maybe they were just setting up for the day? I don't know. It felt like we were in an abandoned restaurant. Our waiter was friendly but seemed like he was new and didn't know much about the menu. He did refill our water without us asking though so that's always a plus. I ordered my fave, babaganoush as a starter - it was alright. I got seafood plate and the salmon was too dry. My husband didn't enjoy his shawarma, said he's had better. Will I come back? Not too sure.
Husband got extremely ill later in the evening from their chicken kabob.  I wasn't feeling too good myself after dining here. Disappointing. Won't be back again.

Went for dinner with a friend.  We all ordered something different and it was all very good.  I had the chicken kabob and it was very moist and flavorful.  My husband had to combo kabob, steak, chicken and lamb and he also enjoyed is dinner.  My friend had a chicken wrap and she too said it was good.  Would definitely go back there.

We arrived for lunch at 11:30. Our server, Kosta, took excellent care of us with his gentle personality and patiently described the dishes for us. The food was excellently prepared, everything delicious and made with love and with very reasonable prices.

Music was at a comfortable level for conversation. The room temperature was pleasant, not cold, not warm, just right. 

The restaurant is exceptionally clean. We enjoyed that there are butcher paper covered tablecloths. Even the three, large, decorative fish tanks are attractive and well-cared for.

Lunch Special are $9.95, with choice of appetizer, entree, beverage and dessert. What's to like about Maza Mediterranean & Turkish Grill? Everything! It's a winner!

Great place . Food is delicious and  resanable price. Friendly employees and very friendly owner Kamil bey with  Magnificent  Turkish hospitality .  I wish in LA there was something like this place. it's a   Very good place for watching sports events   and live music nights also.

We went to Maza again on my birthday in August. We had a pleasant experience as always. Food was amazing. Lili was our server. She was attentive, polite, served with a smile kinda girl. Kunefe was delicious. Thank you for our birthday dessert. Loving it. Delicious!!! We will be back soon.

Hey guys, a little disappointed on a couple of things and ok with others. 

Ordered the chicken shawarma and beef wrap. Both were good. The fries that came with both were cold though (note I ordered from UrberEats, therefore I'd expect them to be cold I guess - even though my house is 6mins from you). Well done on both items not being soggy though. 

But wtf is up with the rice pudding? Having had rice pudding from many other Turkish restaurants over the years from all over the world I sort of had the expectation that they are all the same i.e. good. Thing is too, rice pudding ain't too damn hard to get wrong. But look at the picture of what I received... I thought it was melted cheese or something? Then as I realized it was a burnt rice pudding?!? Why is it even burnt? Oh and no cinnamon. 

Look I feel silly - which I shouldn't be - complaining about $3.95... but this ain't right you guys. Take it off the menu and don't have this crap available! What's really dodgy here is that I rang you guys too, straight away upon receiving my order to ask what was up and the lady's response was "well they know what they're doing". Well guess what, not with this particular item at this particular time. I mean seriously, look at the picture again and tell me they got this one right. What a waste of time, effort, a few dollars and energy you lot.

I came here to introduce a friend to Turkish food and the experience was wonderful. We started with Baba Ganoush appetizer, delicious.  
Our main courses were Kabobs, 1 Shish and the other Adana and both were good but slightly less spicy that I've experienced before, still good. We ended with Kunefe dessert which was  an interesting change. The staff were very accommodating and let us try a few other items. I will definitely go back and refer many friends to try Maza also.

First time here from Denver. Had the Mante and lamb, beef, and chicken kabob. Our server was very welcoming and suggested Kunefe which is the bomb.com! Definitely coming back and bringing friends and family over.

Great service.  Amazing food.  We had the Sultan's Delight, Mediterranean Salad, the Maza Beyti Kebab, and Tzatziki.  All were fantastic.  My only complaint is the location.  It's in somewhat of an abandoned parking lot that's a little sketchy, otherwise I'd give 5 stars,

Exelent place, service and food. WE had chiken kebob, adana kebob and iskender kebab.
All are so tasty.  Service was super fast.

The food is sooooo goood! The chicken, lamb and beef are all so tender and just melt in your mouth. I have never had Mediterranean food in Vegas which was this good before. We also had the seafood platter, again very tasty. I would definitely recommend the rack of lamb, although what my friends got was also very very good! I will definitely come back here! Their baklava is just superb. The owner told us that it is home made. No wonder it tasted so much better than the baklava that you get at other places. Definitely the best baklava I have had in my life so far. Give it a try, I am pretty sure you won't be disappointed.

This place is EMPTY on a Saturday afternoon, but despite that, service was friendly and the food was just as described. We ordered an assortment of things from the menu including the lebni which is sort of like a yogurt/cream cheese type flavor with olive oil and spices. I was so happy to see they offered it since it's one of my favorite things to have with pita (or anything else really) but it isn't something you can get everywhere. It was a hit, as was the juicy chicken kebab and the shwarma wrap that was on special. Entree sizes are great for the price (under or around $10). Even the greek salad was big enough to have leftovers. The employees seemed Persian so that added to the authenticity of the food for sure. They also offered us tea at the end of the meal which was a nice treat. 

Maza would be a great place to have a large group dinner where you reserve the entire dining room.

My husband just returned from a trip and we wanted to have Middle Eastern food. Maza it was!
The decor is "typical tired old restaurant" but clean.
Staff are helpful and very pleasant.
The appetizer was 4 pieces of flavorful but dense felafel. It was more dense than dry but it was hot at least.
Combo kebab platter and chicken kebab were good. The meat was seriously tender. I did not say it was seasoned but it was nicely tender. Rice was good. Tomatoes were undergrilled. There was no grilled onion on the plate. I was sort of lost as the onion should be my companion in every MidEastern meal.
We chose to try bakhlava.
They serve two pieces on the plate.
It was dry and without sufficient honey. Definitely cheaply prepared. My husband's father made home made delicious bakhlava and the version at Maza should not be the reason for your trip over here by any means.
The meal was a solid 3. Not bad but not overwhelming.
Maybe with a serious chef and reasonable expenditure to primp up that dessert and spring for my stinking onion it could really rock.

Got a deal from groupon and went to this place after work, we loved the beef and chicken kabob so much that we went back the next day and tried the lamb chops and baba ganoush! Wow! The food here is amazing!  Good and fast service. From outside it doesn't look inviting but don't be discouraged by that coz inside it is lively with the live music. And they serve hot tea after the meal. Will definitely keep on coming back here. Just purchased again from groupon!
Great food with a great service and good prices. Highly recommended! Sultans delight one of my favorite.
Great Turkish food. Having lived in that part of the world, I ate real Turkish and Mediterranean food. This takes me back! Great service too.
food coma by 25 (groupon stuff:)) combo kabob is the best, seriously. and try the desert as well :)
Great Turkish restaurant, food is delicious and simple, portions are right size, I had the lamp shish kabob very tasty.

Came here because of a group on. Never had proper authentic Mediterranean food but my wife wanted to try so why not. First off the proportions they give you are huge! All the food taste very fresh but it's not my palette. The pricing seemed high but good thing I had the group on. If you love this type d food and want to take a date here ten this place is perfect. The staff is very friendly and gives great service!

" You know when you go to a restaurant and the service is good, but the food is not quite good? There comes a point when the manager comes to you and asks you about the service and the food and their just so nice that you have to lie about the food being good. But service is great. Well ladies and gentlemen you don't have to worry about that here at Maza Grill the food is fantastic!! Hands down, hummus here phenomenal!"

For a restaurant that was half empty on Valentine's Day , my first time here,  the service was OK but myself , my wife and 2 other couples felt that we were being rushed from dish to dish , hadn't even finished one dish when they were bringing another, sometimes overlapping , not that it was necessary because they needed the table, place was only half full at best not to mention some of the food offered was not up to par , the bread took too long to get to us , the sea food plate was dry , the shrimp was soggy , that's what you get when u order seafood in a beef and lamb place and to top it all off nowhere does it say it but you get the unpleasant surprise that they do not have even a beer and wine  license , the server when asked said " Bring your own booze and if it's wine they won't charge corkage fees, that takes some nerve.
Bottom line all 3 couples won't be going back there again

Great restaurant!!!! Great service. Very authentic. 
Would definitely come back. 
We had beef adona and seafood kabob. 

Portions were very generous.

Our first time here. The waitress was very nice and informative with the menu 
Everything she recommend came out delicious.

It's so hard to find good places in this area that are open late so props to them on that! The food is so flavorful, and the tiziki is one of the best around! I really like that the menu is short, and very authentic, but with a little something for every pallet. I was only disappointed in the time it took to get our check, as well as the confusion with seating.

Loved the food, loved the hospitality and service.

Their variety of Turkish food is admirable and great tasting.  Prices are very reasonable and loved the fact that they played Turkish music in the background.  It was as if we were in Turkey!

Keep up the good work!
Amazing food, Lamb chops were extraordinary. Must have family style kabob platter if you visit. Service was great, very homely and welcoming.

Came here with a friend for a late, leisurely lunch and we were not disappointed. Had the sampler appetizer of Baba ganoush, hummus, tzatziki and serma. Wonderful and fresh. For entree, I enjoyed the lamb kabob and my fiend had the combo platter of chicken, beef and lamb kabob. The meat was extremely tender and cooked to order. This was accompanied by a delicious shredded salad. Took leftovers home so we could top our meal off with a Turkish coffee and baklava. The service was great and the meal was memorable. We will be back!

This was the first time I'd been to a Turkish restaurant and the experience was amazing!!!!!! First of all the ambience was very welcoming as soon as we entered.. We were then greeted by a very nice and polite waitress who was very patient with us while we asked her a zillion questions about the menu.. Food came out pretty fast and OMG so tasty... I would definitely recommend this restaurant.. The portions are very fair for the price.. And the owner was very attentive of all the tables.. He made sure we were comfortable, got our food fast, was super friendly and even walked us out after we were done.. But the best part was their bakhlava.. (Request them to warm it up instead of having it cold.. It will add to the taste).. This was by far the best bakhlava I've ever had.. The owner said that his sister makes them fresh which is why they taste good and pretty much homemade..

The food we received was fresh and flavorful. Tons of small sides given to you when eating at the restaurant. The food portions may be small but they are rather flavorful. Most plates are around $12-$15.

I just don't understand why this place is not very packed, they have all the elements needed for a packed restaurant, delicious food, good prices and a great indoor vibe.  
Nonetheless, I recommend this place anyway

Ordered from Maza through Grub Hub after a long day on a convention floor in Las Vegas.  Ordered food for 7 people - took 1 1/2 hours to deliver, called restaurant to complain and woman on the phone was rude.  Driver showed up and was also rude.

They got one order wrong and they didn't deliver two orders.

Emailed Grub Hub and the restaurant only offered a 10% discount, forcing me to call American Express and dispute the charge.  

I would NOT recommend EVER ordering from this restaurant!

The food is great, the prices are very reasonable, and the staff is very friendly. Overall, a wonderful experience. The only reason I haven't given the place 5 stars is because they seem to have opened the restaurant relatively recent and the operation can be more organized! Nevertheless, I highly recommend this place and will definitely return.

If they had a 0 star rating i would leave that. Very unprofessional and rude. Had us waiting 45 minutes for our order and wouldnt even give us an estimated time frame on when the order would be ready. Wouldnt recommend this place to my worst enemy.

I loved the food . Service was fast , our server I didn't ask for her name but she's Turkish with blond hair  she was great so cheerful . I would love to go back there again . Ps: if you practice Ramadan they have  very good specials.

my friends and I came here couple of days ago for dinner.  The menu came with clear photo of the food which I like. They also had finger food like chicken wings.
I had the Beef doner kabab, and the beef was done perfectly, it came with salad or you can sub with french fries and side of radish. I like the house sauce that came with it. My friend had Manti which is Turkish handmade ravioli served with garlic yougurt sauce and red topping. That was ok, the ravioli could be done a little more.

My favorite is Karniyarik which is oven roasted eggplant stuffed with ground beef and special herbs, served with tzatziki and rice pilaf.

For desert, Kunefe was excellent, it's made with cheese pastry soaked in sweet, sugar-based syrup, topped with pistachios.

The atmosphere is a bit more upscale and I love the lanterns and aquariums. 

The young waitress was very attentive.  The price were affordable. I would like to return. I highly recommend!

I super like this place. I bought a deal on groupon. It was so worth it with the amount of food plus free baklava that we got, also the Turkish coffee was awesome. And the girl that helped us was not only strikingly beautiful but very very nice, helpful and informative.

Nice Turkish restaurant with great food. If you come here during lunch time, you get a great deal for $9.99. It includes starter, entree, dessert, and Turkish tea. I tried authentic Turkish dishes and they were great. For lunch I had Hamburger, that was great too. Very friendly timely service by Alex. Recommended.

When it comes to chicken kabob, yes this is as good as it gets! 

FYI: My review will solely be based on their kabobs.

For $10 - $13, you'll receive a side salad or fries, rice, meat of your choice, a grilled tomato and pepper, and pita bread. At most Mediterranean restaurants, I'll go with the beef adana (long, hand-minced meat kebab mounted on a wide iron skewer and grilled) cause it's the safest and pretty consistent at every restaurant. I don't like to go for the regular kebabs because they're usually dried out or over cooked. Maza is the first to prove my kebab assumption to be wrong.
