My first time at Maza, I was on my no carb diet and I wanted to be healthy so I went with the chicken option with no rice and extra salad..a very unexciting meal in my opinion. My friend chose the rice option and I was instantly salivating when they brought it out. They provide a Lebanese style rice with cut bits of vermicelli mixed in - very similar to a rice-a-roni mix. Now as for the chicken, if you know me well, you know that I NEVER order chicken at restaurants because people always like to overcook chicken and dry it out, and I'm not a fan of white meat. However, at Maza I was happily surprised that the chicken is like what Sheila G. said, "BUTTAH." I hate this word but it must also be said, the chicken was sooo MOIST. It's the only thing I order here now. I microwaved the leftovers two days after and you know how sometimes when you microwave meat it just gets tougher cause you're basically cooking it again? NOPE not with this chicken! It stayed tender and just as good as the first night.

I've ordered the lamb kebab, beef, the beef adana, and they're all good as well, however my top choices are the regular lamb and chicken (obviously). The beef wasn't as tender, so if you don't mind gaminess... go for the lamb!

Bonus star: I live near trop and 215 and they were still willing to deliver to me!
Stopped in for lunch had the maza plate,stuffed eggplant and beef kabob everything was very fresh and delicious We will definitely  be back

Extremely expensive. Me, my hubby and 2 toddlers ate for $64 and my kids only ate plain side order of rice(they r picky). Very small portions compare to what we get in Los angeles. So basically for just 2 people they charged automatic gratuity of $8.94. We also got one small knafah (dessert) n the lady offered to add kaymak cream n ended up charging us $3 for half a teaspoon of that cream. I mean i would love to tip but don't make me do it! And let me tell you how nasty the bathrooms were i had to hold my pee until we got to our hotel room. The toilets had poo n period all over. I wish i took a picture (ughhh). Please pay someone to clean your toilets from the automatic gratuity you've been charging. NEVER EVER COMING BACK!
Food is disappointing, service mediocre, portions small compare to all other Mediterranean restaurants in Vegas.
Just got lentil soup and iskender kebab. They were very delicious. They also started serving Kunefe and Sigara borek. If you like any of those you may consider revisiting soon.

Yesterday i was at the restaurant and we had aproblem in our order. The manager dealt with this problem in a very professional way.
I really respect what he did in converting negative experiances to positive ones.

Been here 3 times. It's by my work and I love Mediterranean food. The Food is decent, the place is not the cleanlinest but today the service was so downright awful. Went in today at 2:50 for the lunch special. It says seat yourself so I do. It's not terrible busy or anything. I wait for ten minutes before getting a menu. Then another 5 minutes before she comes to take my order. Because it was 3:06 she refused to give me the lunch special. Okay I didn't think much of it I'm starving and so I ask for the house style salad with shawarma style chicken. I have ordered this before it wasn't a big deal. Well she says umm I don't think they do that. Okay forget it I say let me get the shawarma with the house salad instead of fries. We don't do substitutions so we have to up charge you, are you sure you don't want rice instead of fries? At this point I'm just baffled. What is the big problem here? I'm alone so you worn be getting a large check in? I am tired, hungry and I just wanted to order without a hassle I don't even care about a $3 upcharge, but I do care about being treated with respect and fairness. When you condescend someone at every turn it doesn't make me feel confident the food is worth it. At that point I just told her I would like to pay for m drink and leave. Never going back- I'll stick to Hedarys.

If you've ever had Turkish and not just a "Mediterranean" food. This place is awesome. I lived in Turkey when I was in the military and when this came across my radar. I had to try and it did not disappoint. Lahmacun, Sigara Boregi, ezme, Iskender, Adana, & Doner kabob. Kofte, lamb chops and list goes on. It's just so good! Got to try the kunefe dessert!!!

Food:

High quality, colorful ingredients! 
Very tasty! 
True to the Turkish /Middle Eastern culture!
Great attention to detail w the preparation of the foods...
Salad was so beautiful and yummy, the kabobs... I could eat them everyday w their Medi Salad 
The Ezme was very yummy... tomatoes & pepper paste... looks like a reddish hummus... no chickpeas here 
The Sultan Delight was a very light portion of Lamb layered over baba ghanoush... 
Oh, lovely Sarma, how yummy you are!!! Have them if you love grape leaves (Vegetarian)
Turkish coffee & warm baklava... Yum!

Service:
Very pleasant staff! Alexandrina was very sweet and attentive. .. she made sure we were taken care of and that we were enjoying our food... even offered suggestions & accompaniments...

Ambience:
Local strip mall location... the old Opa!
Not bad at all... the interior is simply decorated w their lovely Turkish lamps 
Small dance floor area for future live entertainment
No liquor license as of this date...

Overall, our dining experience was a very satisfying one... We will definitely return!

Thank you to the Chef for such a wonderful Epicurean experience! 

Thank you, Alex! We will see you soon!

Your constant companion, 

~deirdra
Delicious, I've never liked lamb but I must say the lamb here was really good. We ordered the sampler plate with lamb, chicken and beef. Ended with baklava and Turkish tea.
Excellent and friendly service.Amazing taste.Fast delivery.Make sure try Adana.
Very authentic Mediterranean food in Las Vegas with good place!!! A must to go restaurant.

We have been here a number of times over the last few years.  It has gone from good to fair at best.  Salad was good but Beef Doner was chips of meat over rice with another salad and red cabbage.  No peppers or such as pictured.  The food was barely warm and lacked flavor as I had to use the sauce to season the food.  
Service was ok..friendly but clumbsy and I almost poked her with the fork as she reached on my plate to remove something.  Having been to Turkey and this lacks originality and overall disappointing.  Sorry but won't return...not worth the drive to have a fair experience and average food.

Right near where I live at the corner of Sahara and Rainbow, this Mediterranean restaurant IS THE BEST THERE IS IN LAS VEGAS!! Come here and try exotic dishes on the menu. You can't lose because it's all good.  I can walk here and make it a point to eat here once a month - weekly if I ate that often! The bottom line is that this place has it all: food, atmosphere, drinks and a friendly staff.  WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR?

Just discovered this gem! We've read great reviews but originally heard about it through word of mouth and it met all of our expectations. A romantic and comfortable atmosphere paired with amazing food is not easy to find, so we're glad we found this. Iskender was delicious. Try Kunefe with vanilla ice cream.

I was a little skeptical about this place but gave it a shot anyways. As we walked in the restaurant in was kind of dark and in need of a makeover. The hostess/waitress showed us to our table. Ordered the appetizer platter which was really good. The pita needs a little help though. Ordered the beef shish kabob and the Chicken Adana they were really good and had great flavor nice and moist, rice was good as well just a bit oily for my taste. I didn't care for the salad though if it were finely chopped it would have been a lot better. Service was good and on point.

I would try other dishes but would probably take out rather than dine in.

Thank you Yelp reviewers!! My husband and I are visiting Vegas and headed here after reading others' enthusiastic and positive reviews. They were very right. We had the hummus and falafel to start- perfectly made falafel in my opinion- soft on the inside and crispy on the outside, wonderfully seasoned- very good! My husband had the seafood kabob with rice and he loved it at first bite. I had the combo kabob and thought the lamb was the best- tender and seasoned well. We were so full we couldn't try dessert. Our waitress was sweet and attentive. All around we had a great experience here and I would highly recommend others to go!

Ordered take-out for dinner last night. I got the Kofte entree and some hummus. I tasted the hummus first. Was pretty good. Not
The best, but definitely better than most. Had to set it aside because I knew it would fill me up too fast, and I had a whole container of Kofte to tackle. It was awesome. Killed it off-all of it. Well most of it. The hot pepper on the side really kicked my ass, but everything else was good. The salad may have been a little peppery. No big deal. Need to end this review. I have some left-over hummus to eat.

Very delicious. Had the prime beef skewers with the Hummus which tasted real good. Nice mellow atmosphere and the service was good. Tall younger server had some nice suggestions for us. Cannot wait to try again in the future. Ate there and is good to go as well. Give them a try!
We tried babaganoush and ezme as appetizers. Then we had "doner" that was the kind you can see everywhere in Turkey. We topped it off with baklava. Overall it is awesome.

Great food, friendly service.  I was a little confused as to the stage in the corner of the room and the bar that was used as fish tank stands. As far as the dining room itself it needs updating.  Give it some identity.  Is it a night club? A bar or a fine dining establishment?  By the sign in the front reception room you would think someone would at least great you.  However you seat yourself so why is there even a hostes table?  Maybe they have lots of patrons at other times of the day?  Everything was good but your decor needs a revamp.   Bathrooms were clean.  Overall was happy with our lunch.
Got a groupon, had a really nice meal. Big plates, lots of variety, great service. Was a cute little dining experience and had a great sampler of appetizers
One of the best meditiranian restaurant in town. Delicious food awesome service. .I m already addicted to this place, god job guys. ..

Wow, we ate here last night for the first time last night and we are STILL talking about it! The food was perfect in every way and the prices are very reasonable.

We ordered:
Cheese plate appetizer - sliced moist Bulgarian feta with piles of fresh herbs like
                                         Basil, dill, mint, and also some green onions
Sampler Appetizer - hummus, baba ganoush, tabbouleh, and dolmas
Chicken kebab
Veggie kebab
Combo kebab
Beef shwarma

The appetizers were delicious. I was especially impressed with the giant piles of fresh herbs served with the yummy Bulgarian feta on the cheese plate.  American feta is more on the dry and crumbly side, so we appreciate restaurants that serve the moist and creamy Bulgarian type. This place got my honey to try mint and dill leaves for the first time too, and he enjoyed it! Score! The sampler appetizer was  fantastic. We enjoyed the hummus and dolmas, and I was hooked on the tabbouleh salad. Baba ganoush was yummy too.

On to the main course....  We each ordered kebabs. Every thing we ordered was seasoned perfectly and was served beautifully on the plates. All of the meat and veggies were grilled with skill as they were so moist. The grilled veggies had the perfect amount of charring on them. All dinners come with some grilled veggies (tomato, onions, and jalapeño), jasmine rice or fries, and a salad. We each had salad and rice. Salad was delicious and had a unique dressing. It was light with good flavor and we enjoyed it. The jasmine rice was amazing. I  usually forego the carby side dishes, but I couldn't keep my fork out of this rice....super yum!!!

It's worth noting this places does not have a liquor license. However, don't let that be a deal breaker for you, as you can BYOB. We will be doing that for beer and wine next time. There is also a convenience store in the same parking lot you can run into to in case you forget.  

We ordered so much food my only regret was not saving room for dessert. I'm not really worried....as we can wait to go back!!!
Good portion, great price and nice staff. We love the Chicken kabob and shawarmas, melts in your mouth.

Another wonderful meal at Maza. I love this place! We used our prix-fixe meal for 2 from Groupon today. The service was exceptional and the food was just ah-mazing! We had the Maza sampler  and for our entrees, we both had the combo Kabob. We should have braced ourselves, I know but the babaganoush, hummus, tabbouleh and sarma were so good we could not stop eating. Add to that the warm pita slices. By the time our entrees came, we were pretty full. The lamb, beef and chicken pieces were so moist, perfectly cooked and seasoned. The last time we were here, the chicken was a little dry, this time everything was cooked perfectIy.  Personally, I still prefer the lamb and beef. It even seems like they gave us more meat or the pieces got bigger. Even the salad was huge. Not complaining though :) . Of course the meal came with baklava for dessert(which we asked to go) and Turkish tea.  We will definitely be back.

Been here several times and I like this place more and more each time. Foods seems to be getting better and better each time and service is always exceptional. Never crowded and each waitress has been extremely nice and attentive. The pita bread app comes out warm and tasty and the hummus is so good. We have been to several Mediterranean restaurants in town and Maza makes the best chicken kabobs, marinated so tasty and juicy and cooked just right. Had the chicken wrap (sandwich) once and that was really good too. They have groupon and coupons in the flyers for 1/2 off an entree or $5 off or free Baklava dessert and they always take both the $5 and give the free baklava too, bonus!  Plus they give you free Turkish hot tea at end too which is tasty. No complaints except they stop taking restaurant.com certificates for some reason and I still had one (never expire). They were nice and apologetic about it but still was a disappointment. Fortunately restaurant.com is great about exchanging  unused certificates for new ones. Decor is very nice (upscale) and prices are reasonable.

Owner and staff really friendly...
Place is clean and new.
Food is great and only real Turkish restaurant in Las Vegas.
Very good Authentic food big space relaxing music and good food what do you need more

I have been to this place twice and both times they were EXTREMLY late. I ordered the food and waited 25-30 minutes for the gyro wrap. Yes, only gyro wrap. My advice to their management: add more server, you are losing customers...

So so good! I had a ground beef kebab (forgot the name) but my oh my were the flavors spot on. I was greeted by the most pleasant hostess and the wait staff was a joy to be catered by. Definitely a must if you want to try a hole in the wall resturaunt in Vegas. On my list of top 10 resturaunts here.

This place is a pretty good establishment and the atmosphere was pretty nice especially with the Live Singer singing in different languages, it was pretty cool!  The salads they bring were really good and we also had an appetizer of Pickled Mixed Vegetables which definitely lived up to their name. The main Entree that me and my guest both had was the Chicken Kabob, she had it with rice and I had it with french fries. The meat was served with seasoned tortillas with red sauce, a whole baby tomato, and a whole jalapeno pepper to really spice things up! The service was Excellent from the hostess and the waitress. They did regular checks on us to make sure all was OK and they even had good suggestions on the menu items. They even had chicken fingers and chicken wings for those that aren't to into Mediterranean foods or kids. We finished up with some dessert so we chose the Baklava that was served with Turkish Tea and that was Delicious!!! Everything was great, the presentation of all the food was Excellent and I would recommend this great eating establishment to anyone, especially if you like Mediterranean foods.

Only tried the appetizers this time (just because we were too full to have a meet entree as well)
Humus, labani, tabula and more were amazing!!
All super delicious and most important fresh!!
Will def come back soon!!
My new local fav for lunch and dinner
This was our firsts time here and the food was absolutely fantastic. The 2 servers were extremely friendly and they even gave us complimentary Turkish tea

The environment is very warm and inviting. The food is delicious and great quality. The service is also wonderful! They're very attentive and helpful. Their Turkish coffee was fantastic! I highly recommend it.

I've had a lot of Turkish food that was really middle eastern food so I wasnt sure and my expectations were that it would be middle eastern. I ordered sarma, which most people know as dolma, they were delicious! Very authentic AND Turkish for sure. All the food to follow was very good. 

As a visitor I would have to say that The area is not a great location but dont let that stop you, it is worth the drive from the strip! The staff who served us were friendly and the food was very good!

Very delicious!!

My bf and I ordered Hummus, Chicken Adana Kabob, Kofta Kabob, Baklava and turkish coffee. The food was very delicious and had a lot of flavor. The staff was very welcoming. Will definitely go back again. =D

Went for lunch yesterday at 1:45 p.m. Sadly, the worst we've had in Las Vegas. Started with the lenal soup which was horrible. Tasted like canned Cambell's soup with maybe puree'd lentles ... not sure it was pretty bland. No flavor. Wife's Greek salad was just ... meh, okay. Nothing remarkable, can get this anywhere. I had a Gyro sandwich which was cold, not warm. Cold. I believe it should have been warm. It was served with 3 canned pickles on a plate with a small plastic container with an ounce of thousand island salad dressing. Maybe for the limp fries. Greek? I don't think so. The reviews all show decent. Umm ... not even close. Maybe the business does this to generate interest. The owner was there I think. He was courteous to all the middle eastern patrons but us white people he avoided even a welcome. All I know is what tastes good. In a competitive market, quality and at least feeling appreciated as a customer goes a long way. Yes, there are lot's of great choices in Las Vegas so sadly, avoid this place. There are much, much, much, much better restaurants for equal or cheaper prices. We've been to Paymon's up on Sahara at Durango, it was by far better with great customer service.

I would like to give compliment about great service but when it comes to taste of the food& cleanlinnes this is one of the worst worst place I've ever been. the rice i had 100/ percent im sure it was couple days old    Ingredients was not fresh the silverware& plates theyre using  really old dirty i wonder how much new dozen of silverware cost trustme doesnt cost more than $10 dollar. Turkish tea worst also  needless to say i wouldn't  reccomend
Went here for the first time with my friends and the food was amazing. Even though there were some items on the menu that were not available, it was still good.

We are always looking for a great mediterranean restaurant, we have tried a couple on this side of town and have been disappointed dry overdone and poor wait service.  

I was a bit surprised when we walked in and it was pretty bare, but it was a sunday night.  We were seated by a very friendly nice young lady, we later found out was from the Ukraine so some of the food is worded differently and has some difference.  For instance we ordered Sarma is very similar to Dolmades I could tell the difference in texture, Sarma seamed softer more creamy texture, I liked it a lot better then Dolmades!  The next app was Baba Ghanoush it is a cooked eggplant dish similar to a Hummus or a baked artichoke dip without the high fat in artichoke dip.  I loved it creamy soft with lots of flavors and low in fat with a warm soft fresh pita, Soso GOODgood.

The dinner was as good, we opted for the signature burger Maza Burger, I know strange choice but they made it sound so good in the menu and we were not super hungry it just looked good and it was.  It is not the normal burger I think it may have had lamb in it, it was soft and bold in flavor but the softer flavors blended everything together and the spicy sauce made it a great burger.  It also had lettuce, tomato, a pickled something or other it wasn't a pickle but it kind of was a pickle.  I wish I would have asked I will next time I kind of love pickles! 

My next visit I am going to get the lamb, i was just not hungry enough this time.

The service was A+ she came back a few times even though it did start to fill up as we ate.  I like how she was proud of her heritage and knowledge of food from her reign to explain small details is great detail.

I was very happy and will be going back, it is close to home and easy to pick up, now if they only had delivery...

This has got to be one of the best Mediterranean restaurants in town. My wife and I enjoy their stile of cooking and often bring family and friends when celebrating birthdays or Holidays. 

I recommend it to anyone who is looking for excellent food at affordable prices.  Oh, don't forget your appetite so you can have Kanaffi for Desert.

This place is a gem. Good size portions at a very reasonable  price. I had the chicken and beef  kabob and they are both adequately seasoned and tender. I will definitely  come back to this place.  Don't  forget dessert. The kunefe is to die for. Geat service as well.

They have good food, however I was pretty upset that recently I received an email from them addressing to my business email.  That means they randomly go out and gather information from people's business card at other places and using it as an advertisement method and send out spam mail.  Maza just lost several customers that way, they better stop doing this, I will never support them for as long as they don't take me off of their mailing list that I never subscribe to begin with.  And no I have NEVER drop off my business card at their restaurant
Great food here but atmosphere could be better.  I've been here a couple times where they have several kids just run around the entire restaurant playing around. Not fun for other guests to witness.
Maza Mediterranean/Turkish Grill. Spending time, having dinner with my family. Ezme is great. You should taste it. Waiting for doner and kebab.

The place is good and the food is good. Earlier in the day everything is better . Towards the end of the night it loses few points. But that shouldn't deter you, just don't go after 10 pm . They are out of doner and some other dishes due to how busy the evening service was.

Hands down best casual Mediterranean place I have been too. Tried awhile back when I had a Groupon and been hooked ever since. 

The chicken kebab is soo tasteful and moist. It's crazy how perfectly cooked it is. Seafood kebab is also very good. I always know when I come to this place the quality will be on point and the value is tremendous. $10.95 for a huge plate of chicken kebab, huge pieces of chicken! Love this place!

the food here is delicious! there is a decent variety of mediterranean food - we got a gyro and a mixed kebob and it was Turkish style, which is exactly what we wanted! the prices are great especially for how much food you get. i will definitely go here again.

Got delivery from this place. I actually didn't like the soup or the falafel very much at all. However the pita was awesome and so was the Eggplant with ground beef dish from the Turkish area of the menu. It came with rice and charred tomato, both of which were very good. Just for that dish alone I think 3.5 stars rounding up to 4 is pretty fair. Prompt delivery, so I am sure I'll order from them again.

I have ordered delivery from Maza numerous times and pickup a couple of times.  The food is consistently good, and the portions are huge.  The hummus serving is very generous and I always ask for extra pita to stretch it out.  Today when I ordered they had a new type of pita that was fluffier than normal pita and very tasty.  Their kabobs are very good, I often order sarma, which is well spiced and the entrees come with a nice sized salad.  The only inconsistent thing I've had was the rice pudding.  A couple of times it was mediocre, however today it was deliciously sweet.  I'll keep ordering from this restaurant.

We ordered the seafood kabob, beef kabob, combo kabob, lamb chops, and lamb shank.   We also had a groupon for the Maza platter/sampler for 4 people, which came with 4 different appetizers- hummus, babaghanoush, tabouli and tzatziki for the pita bread, 4 entrees  as well as 4 pieces of baclava for dessert. The pita bread was very good, even without the sauces, but in the actual meals, the meat was put on top of the pita bread, which made it soggy. The meats were tender and flavorful, and the salmon in particular was very tender and well seasoned, and so was the shrimp. The seafood platter is my favorite. I didn't get to try the lamb dishes but  must be very good as my companions cleaned up their plates. 

Our servers are really nice and efficient. Price is very reasonable. Delicious food. Highly recommended.

This place is pretty dang good. The best part of the deal is their price. Great price point for food and location. I got the Kafta plate, which came with some awesoooooooome sauce and rice and a mini salad that was tart. My friend had the chicken shawarma wrap which was delicious!!!!!! The pita is freshly toasted and warm. I will come back for the shawarma wrap as well as other dishes.

We came here from out of town. We were on the strip and wanted somewhere new to eat. We checked Yelp and we were impressed by the high rating. We all ordered different kabobs and were very disappointed. The meat was dry and portions are very small!

It use to
Be my favorite I dine in in maza and even deliver but for last few deliveries I feel meat is not well cooked, and spices are missing from meat and salad and quantity is reduced

The food here was Awesome! I tried something new while I was here and it was delicious. I was not a fan of the salad that came with the meal but just too much food for me! Hummus and Bread was amazing!
Very Good food at Reasonable price. Would like some more consistency though, food never bad just not always great. That would make it 5 stars.

It's best Mediterranean and Turkish food at town. I been here almost every week and almost 5 star service. They been improving quality and service day by day. Owner and employees are so friendly and their Doner kabob is best all of USA. You must try.

We tried Maza Mediterranean on a Weds during lunch.  It was quiet and we weren't expecting much.  I had a craving for chicken skewers so we picked Maza.  We are so glad we stopped by, the chicken skewers were the moist chicken I've ever tasted. The portions are huge and an entree comes with a big bowl of salad. All under $10!  What a deal.  I couldn't believe how great the food tasted and how fresh all the dishes were, it was a great find!

We also had a last minute post - wedding brunch at Maza last Sunday. We called an hour in advance and asked for 2 tables for 30 people!  An hour in advance!! They were able to accommodate us, no problem!  We order a few shared platters and shared family style.  All the dishes were prepared and presented beautifully. Our server was polite and on top of things. Everyone thought the food was amazing. These people come from all over the U.S, Boston, NY, SF, LA - great foodie areas and all said the food was exceptional.  

Often times with brunch with a big group, you have to wait either a long time to get a table, reserve months in advance and pay a deposit.  Maza made it so easy to organize a last minute wedding event that didn't cost us and arm and a leg.  

Any big group dinners I plan again we will definitely be back at Maza.  I can't wait to visit again!

I needed a lunch spot in this area and turned to Yelp for recommendations. I went on a recent Wednesday afternoon at noon. I walked in and another guy walked in at the same time. It was empty and there was no one in the entry. We waited and waited. Finally, a young lady came out and offered to help us. When I told her I needed a table for two, she told me to sit wherever I wanted. If that's the case, then why don't you just have a sign that says "Please seat yourself"?  Instead I had just been standing in the entry like a fool.

My lunch companion arrived shortly thereafter. We haven't seen each other in years so we spent some time catching up.  The server did come by a couple of times, but we were never ready. Then she disappeared. It wasn't busy but she was the only person I saw working. Also, because she let people seat themselves, the few tables were in different corners, which didn't make a lot of sense. Finally we flagged her down. We both ordered salads, which took way too long to come out. I had the Mediterranean salad with chicken and my friend had the Greek salad with salmon. The salad was tasty, but nothing amazing. It did have a lot of dill in it. Once again it was time to wait for the server to pick up our plates and give us our check. Took quite a while once again. All in all, I was there about 2 hours for a salad.

I probably won't go back. I don't live anywhere near this place and there was nothing really compelling to get me to go back.

Maza is quickly becoming one of our favorites. The food is priced decently and though some dishes I like better than others, I haven't had anything that I don't like and we've tried out quite a few items off the menu. The service is attentive without being too fussy. They also have a really awesome weekday lunch special with that includes appetizer, drink, entree, and dessert for under $10. 

Every 3rd Saturday afternoon there's a group that comes in and plays fun accordian music on stage, which might not be everyone's cup of tea but it's a definite draw for my husband.

Strike 2 with this place. After craving sarma for at least a week now, I decide to order delivery from Maza & get my yummy grape leaves, only to have the delivery driver show up, minus the order of them. Apparently they were supposed to call me and tell me that they were out of them but failed to do so. The last time they delivered to us, they said we aren't within the delivery range and took it upon themselves to charge an extra $2 after telling us the delivery fee was only $3. Mind you, they have delivered to our office many times before. I'm so disappointed in the last 2 times ordering from them that I'm going to consider anywhere else before them in the future.

We have been there several times over the last few months. It seems like they're ordering a different quality of food or ingredients than previously. As examples, their french fries, which used to be delicious, are now thin and overly salted, their chicken is not as tender, their feta has a stronger taste, and their Mediterranean salad is not the same. It's almost as if the ratio of their ingredients changed and they no longer cut the tomatoes, cucumbers, and herbs into as small of pieces as before.  

Hands-down, we used to absolutely crave and rave about this food. Now, I don't even really want to go. We used to go here once a week, and I probably haven't been there more than three times in the past six months. I don't know what's going on but lots has changed. I've seen the same owner, so that's not it.

Wonderful! First authentic tasting Turkish Adana Kebob. I've been to many in Vegas and most don't live up to real tasting at normal prices. Alex was so nice to us! She was very sweet and gave us complimentary baklava to go!! I will go again. Turkish tea was awesome too!!

Love the food! I come to Vegas once or twice a year for conferences and have been here twice before. Shortly after arriving today, we headed to Maza and ordered our food. To start we ordered ezme, shepherd salad, lentil soup then we ordered chicken Adana kabab and beef Adana kabab plates. We finished with hot tea. Food was fresh, tasty, and we enjoyed it after a long day of travel. We will be back and good luck to you all.

Saturday night and this joint was jumping.  There were three large groups holding forth, several other tables were occupied, and three more tables filled up just after us.  It's a big place, so there were still tables to be had, but the blaring music presented by a guy who was part DJ, part singer, and fully master of none :) added to the frenzy of activity.  The music - some Turkish, some American - was sometimes too loud, but not always.

Hubby went in first, but I lagged behind to take in the cold night air for a bit.  Before I could even open the menu, the waitress came to take our order, and of course I wasn't ready.  She attentively returned a couple more times, and then as soon as we gave our order she said she'd be right back with our salads.  That didn't happen.  We waited and waited while the three tables were served their appetizers (we're not big eaters, so we didn't order appys), then their main courses.  

I could have been nursing my glass of wine, but we didn't have any.  Though I had read the Yelp reviews earlier and knew that it was BYOB, I forgot to take a bottle with us, so it was a dry dinner.  I could have been munching on the pita, but we didn't get that until the salads came.  They finally arrived after we asked the waitress to bring them.

In an uncharacteristic move, we both ordered the combo kebab platter, both of which came with salads served before the main course.  That was nice, since it was a larger portion than many Mediterranean places that put it on the plate with the entree.  The light and lemony dressing was nice, not overpoweringly acidic.  What I didn't like was the iceberg lettuce; romaine would have been so much more interesting and tasty.

The kebabs were wonderful.  The chicken was like buttah, so tender and juicy.  My first piece of the beef wasn't as tender, but all the others were, including the lamb.  I liked the interesting touch of the little cup of red salsa (is that the ezme?) served along with the kebabs, which added a little kick, and would have appreciated a small cup of lebni, the strained yogurt that other middle eastern restaurants often include. But that seemed to be available only as an appetizer.  The rice was perfect.  Only the pita was a disappointment, okay when first put on the table, but then dried-out, too chewy, and tasteless. 

We took advantage of the Yelp-baklava offer.  While I'm not usually a big lover of baklava, this one was excellent.  And the small cup of Turkish tea we were served at the end was a very nice and welcome touch. 

Despite the amount of time we had to wait to fill our stomachs, the food was delicious:  well-prepared, not oversalted, and the portions well-sized.  We will definitely go back.

Great food, friendly attentive service 
Definitely a great experience 
Took a foreign exchange student who was missing her cuisine
The food was good. Very small portions though. Completely under staff. Waited so long. And the worst thing was a loud fight in the kitchen that was very bad and awkward and we were shocked

Delicious food.
Nice looking restaurant.
Great customer service.
Ground beef kabob plate is delish. Even the rice that comes with it is different than I've ever tried, so good.
Burgers are juicy, very filling, and flavorful.
Also love the french fries, they normally come with a light seasoning that's unique to this restaurant. 
They bring you a basket of sesame bread with butter that's so addictive.
Over all, definitely one of my favorite places to eat in LV.
Great food & quick service enjoyed a meal with a great amount of portion under $10. Would return again someday.

This is the best Turkish restaurant in town. The food is amazing! I am Turkish and in my opinion you don't wanna miss sultan's delight and kunefe here! These are as good as eating in Turkey! The staff was very friendly and very helpful specially Damla. We will go there in every opportunity.

Great spot for authentic food.  Quick, friendly service.
Only wish they had beer and wine or full liquor license.

We came here at least 4 times by now and we are never disappointed.Good food great simple warm atmosphere.
You can never go wrong with the Turkish breakfast.
My husband tried the gyro last time we were there and his exact words were: this is the best gyro I have ever had.

Gyro was great, hummus was delicious, french fries some were a little hard. However we ordered a delivery and when it arrived, the delivery person unpolitely said next time we would have to come downstairs to pick it up, we have an elevator which I explained and they company policy. no explaination and it was unprofessional and seemed rude.  This alone will affect me reordering.

This was my first time here. My family loves going to Mediterranean restaurants. This is certainly one of the best! Their food was extremely tasty! I have never eaten baba ganoush or hummus this fresh and delicious. I was very, very impressed. Their portion sizes are great and they offer free Turkish tea (AMAZING) after your meal.
Our waiter was a tall gentleman who was extremely respectful and kind. We have never had a waiter so considerate and kind. He was always checking on us to see if there was anything he could get or help us with while choosing our food. He helped make for a fabulous experience and we will certainly be coming back!

Mouth watering food. Yummmmm. Will definitely visit again. Got there and was seated immediately. Waitress answered any questions we had about the menu and made some suggestions. I ordered salmon and shrimp. With salad. Wow wow, the food was so well seasoned. My 2yr old is not a big seafood eater, but he ate 3 shrimps and 3/4 salmon. I was in awe. I guess it must have been that good. Wil definitely recommend this place. Good food. Good atmosphere and very reasonable prices. Plus the waitress was very personable.

The food took a while to come out despite the fact that the restaurant wasn't too crowded. The service was not the greatest; it seemed like the waiters were running away from you before you could try and ask for anything. However the food itself was delicious. We had a large party and ordered the chicken kebab and lamb kebab as well as the doner kebab all of which were delicious. The falafels were great and so was the hummus and baba ganoush. Would definitely come back despite the mediocre service.
Very good food and reasonable price. I come here once a week from work. Staff are nice too. I recommend their turkish apple tea.
Food was great! Our waitress was AWSOME and reasonable price! I got the combo with lamb beef and shrimp

The food was amazing! We came using a Groupon but the food is worth full value. The chicken is tender, shrimp is succulent, and baklava is mouth watering! We don't like tea but their Turkish tea was yummy! Thank you Lilia for wonderful service!

I catered from here two days in a row. Consistently great food- chicken kabobs are tender and well-spiced, rice perfect, pita fresh and doesn't stake quickly, and the Mediterranean salad is lightly dressed, light and very tasty! Both clients I catered for asked where the food is from and thoroughly enjoyed. They delivered ahead of schedule and are moderately priced. Highly recommend!
Great kebabs and I love the mediterranean salad. Don't miss out on the baklava either!  Service is very good as well. Definitely put this place on your list.

On entering we found this very large restaurant was largely empty early on a  Friday evening.  We started off with the Sultan's Delight appetizer - a generous portion of braised lamb over silky roasted eggplant (babannush?) that we almost finished.  For entrees we shared orders of lamb and chicken skewers which came with jasmine rice, a grilled pepper and tomato,  pita-type bread and side salads.  The chicken was moist and the lamb tasty though more overdone than we generally prefer.

"Racks on racks" That rack of lamb tho, is a must... Seasoned with precision. Hummus is a go-to for any meddi spot. Salmon kabob was crisp and succulent, good when u and beef need some time to "meet other proteins." Rice for the entrees was on point, like Stockton to Malone. Overall pretty good, flava u can savor.

A co-worker told me about Maza which prompted me to give it a try. 

I used Yelp to browse the menu and I called in my order for pick up. 

I ordered the Veggie Kebab. I stopped in to pick up my lunch and it was ready when promised. 

As I mentioned, this was a to go order. When I opened it up my first thought was that the presentation was nice. The food was packaged up thoughtfully. A piece of foil separated the hot food from the salad. 

I was impressed with the food. The vegetables were flavorful. Onions, mushrooms, eggplant, and peppers on a bed of rice pilaf, yum!! 

I will definitely be back. I read another review which says they have lunch specials during the week for under 10 bucks.

Great service and delicious food! A must try! The Chicken Kabobs are marinated to perfection! The tea comes in a Turkish tea cup with cute lil sugar cubes and the dessert is by far something I've never had but oh so delicious! If you wanna to try authentic Mediterranean food this here is the place! Food is made with passion and you can taste the quality.
Place was really good. I went for lunch there and it was just the best! enjoyed the food my favorite appetizer was the flat bread and hummus!!! the food was delicious. you guys must try!!!

This is my second visit to Maza. Our entire visit was very good. Iskender was delicious. If you like Gyro, I can tell you one thing. This place makes it here, in house, from real quality cut meat. You can tell from the lines on the cuts. Most other places in town ( almost all ) has a block of factory made chunk/block that they buy wholesale. Those are white/gray when cold , with massive amount of fat and unknown meats. 

 We have tried Ezme, cacik, Iskender, tea, Turkish coffee and Kunefe for desert. Every single one of them were proper and deserves 5 stars. Finally, there is a proper Turkish restaurant in town.
It's good food health. I know hated Turkish. But they are nice. So, move on! I love it these healthy foods! I will be come to Maza often.

Good food and good service but it seems they are not used to a high volume of customers or they were backed up in the kitchen because the food took an hour to get to our table.. This place is really good but because of this experience we definitely will look for another place for Mediterranean food..

I came here for lunch recently after buying their groupon.

I got their mediterranean salad, babaganush, and the combo kabob.

The babaganush came out first. This was the first time I ate this dish, so I didn't know what it was supposed to taste like. I didn't really taste the eggplant but I could taste the garlic and olive oil. I probably won't get this again when I return.

Then came the mediterranean salad. It was the best thing I ate. All of the vegetables were so crisp and fresh, they all had good flavor and the herbs helped brighten all of the flavors of the vegetables further.

The kabob combo was good as well. All of the meat was grilled perfectly and it was all moist. I couldn't really taste the seasoning on any of of the meat. The tatziki sauce and red tomatoe based sauce that came with everything helped add constrasting flavor. The fries were seasoned well, hot, and crisp. The pita bread that came with everything I ordered was soft and warm, with good flavor on it's own. I also got a couple of pieces of baklava for checking into Yelp.

Service was excellent, my drink never went empty, my orders came out correct, and I was given plenty of extra napkins.

The food and service was so good, I ordered another groupon to come again. I'll keep coming as long as they have a groupon, and I would come even without a groupon.

Pide. Lahmacun. Kebabs. Döner. Fresh Pita. Kunefe. Need I say more?

Maza know's what they're doing! It looks a little rough around the edges (they were repainting the exterior when I went) but the inside dining room is gorgeous! They have three salt water fish tanks (easy entertainment for children) and an area where live music plays on some nights. 

I wish I knew the name of the gal that was serving us but the food has taken over my brain. She was awesome! Very attentive to our needs and always made sure we had our glasses filled.

The food was ON POINT. I would describe each item we had but that means this review would be forever long and I'd be repeating myself because everything was PERFECT. The pide was flawlessly soft and the döner was flat out delicious. We had heaping handfuls of leftovers due to their generous portions and our server was so kind to label what each of the boxes contained, so we easily knew how to distribute at the end of the evening.

I don't regret anything I ate, but I'm pretty sure I had a food hangover the next day, so be sure to head over here when you're hungry!

This is the most horrible hospitality experience I have ever had. 30 minutes to get a cup of water, waitress barely talks to you and has an attitude like if you owe her something. 1 hour later we got the food and it was cold but we still were ok so far because we were being understanding since the place was a bit busy. THEN!!! We order kunafe and tea that took about 30 minutes itself like if they went picking the tea leaves or something. They come with the stuff meanwhile our dirty dinner dishes are still laid in the table like if it's a normal thing for a waitress not to pick that up before bringing dessert. Mind you the entire time she's back and forth helping other customers. We try the tea it's cold like an iced tea!!! Are you freaking kidding me! Plus they served it to us in 3 different cup sizes. Each one of us had a different one. Last after this horrid experience, the waitress split the check but charged both on the same card like really?? How hard is it for you to figure out 2 different cards?? Mind you we actually wrote it very detailed on the paper to make sure which total to charge to which card. Owner comes to apologize since he saw we were complaining to Tony (their only helpful friendly waiter) as our waitress walks away from the conversation. Very rude and disrespectful. I wouldn't recommend it at all.
Great place, loved the food, excellent prices, and huge portions! The baklava is to die for! Totally loved the cup of tea that came with it. Nice touch!!!

My office has ordered from this place before and the food was pretty good, so myself and another coworker decided to order again. I called in to have it delivered and I was first told that they don't deliver over this way because it's too far...I assured the person I was speaking with that they've delivered to this office before, and after giving her the actual address, as opposed to just the cross streets she asked me for, sure enough my office was in their system...so I place the order, and was told the price....it was sort of high for 2 things that should have come to a touch over $20 but I figured that there was a delivery charge even though I wasn't told there was, nor is it written anywhere on the menu, but I'm no stranger to takeout....  I was told it would be about 45 min, which usually means an hour, and that's right around the time it came, so no worries there.....however when I go to pay, the price has gone up since I placed the order! Really?! I told the delivery person the price I was quoted, and she said they charged extra because it was further.  Um who does that? Who charges someone without telling them? I expected the first charge, but a second at the door? To a place you've delivered to before? Not to mention that they were the ones that brought the menu to us in the first place?! Yeah, ok....last time.

I've ordered combo kabob and kuru fasulye.  The food didn't taste anything like Turkish food. Kabob pieces were burned. I had to manually remove dark-burned areas. Kuru fasulye didn't have any flavor.  Overall,  i didn't enjoy the food.

Amazing!!!! Anyone who loves Mediterranean/ Turkish food NEEDS to come here! This is THE SPOT for your cravings. Food is delicious and workers are friendly, even the owner. Will always keep coming back!
Love/Hate relationship. Amazing food BUT they definitely need to step their service game up. I would still return when in Vegas for the quality & price of food because you can't beat it.

Hands down, the best Mediterranean restaurant in Las Vegas, and most probably, in States!! You do not only taste the amazing Mediterranean and Turkish cuisine here but also experience the unique hospitality of these amazing regions. The restaurant provides variety of top-quality dishes prepared and served in such traditional ways paying full attention to every detail! 

Their menu includes dishes ranging from Turkish breakfast to Iskender Doner Kebab, as well as, Lahmacun to variety of Pides. Their desserts such as Kunefe are spectacular! You will see the photos that I took. They speak for themselves! Plus, the restaurant has a gorgeous Mediterranean-style interior-architecture. All menu items I had were very fresh and made from scratch. Restaurant is very clean, and well-organized. All the staff is extremely friendly. Such an excellent level of customer service!! 

As reviewing such an excellent restaurant, one has to mention that the restaurant has a chef who aims perfection in his cooking. You can feel, see and taste his unique signature on each dish!
 
If you want to feel like at a warm Mediterranean home, I highly recommend you this amazing restaurant!!

Grilled veggies are my favorite! I don't know if Maza takes the time to sprinkle something magical on top to make me so addicted, probably now that I think about it, but I can't help my vegan self when I go in to order.

My boyfriend and I stopped in for a late lunch/early dinner. The food was really good and Alex was very friendly and nice.
We were the only ones in the restaurant when we popped in and we remained the only ones for a decent portion of our time there. We liked that it was quiet and I enjoyed the music they had playing.
We had the Falafel, Mediterranean Salad, Hummus, and Grilled Vegetarian Salad. We both really liked that the falafel were warm, and the eggplant spread it sat on was cold. The Mediterranean salad was very good! Unfortunately, our mouths are particularly sensitive to vinegar-y food, so we were not able to fully enjoy it. The grilled vegetarian salad was really good with the pita bread. I didn't have much of the hummus, but we are taking it home, and you simply can't go wrong with hummus. 
Alex mentioned to us to check in on yelp to get the free baklava dessert, and it was not a mistake. Absolutely loved it, and ordered a cup of american coffee to go with. Went perfectly together, and was a great end to the dinner. 
Unfortunately, there were not many vegetarian options. I would love to come back to see a wider variety for those who do not eat meat. 
My boyfriend had some sun shining in his eyes through the window, so he stood up to close the blinds. In doing so, he hit his head on the hanging light. The glass shade ended up popping off and falling to the ground. Thankfully, it didn't break. The servers said it was okay and fixed it. My boyfriend was laughing, but we were both pretty embarrassed. Alex ended up shutting the shade for us, and told us a story about another customer who had an issue with the sunshade as well. I am glad they were understanding.
So overall, 4/5 for the friendly and great service, tasty food, and light and quiet atmosphere,  but not very wide variety for vegetarians.

Love this place. Great service. Amazing food. And very good quality. 

No other Turkish restaurant in town like this one. 

I recommend the seafood platter and their Turkish coffee.

This place is delicious! I always go for the beef kofta. It's like ground beef shaped into little balls. Comes with rice and salad and grilled tomato and peppers. Also the baba ganoush is amazing! There is a dessert that is like a pastry with honey and cheese which comes warm and it's definitely a must try! Otherwise the baklava is always a good choice and made in house! Not to mention the great service! There are great lunch specials and really good Turkish coffee. Everyone is extremely friendly and helpful it's like a family owned business. Definitely a hidden gym in Vegas if you're looking for a yummy authentic Mediterranean/Turkish food spot.

This is a Great Family Friendly Restaurant with AMAZING FOOD!! Definitely the best lamb chops in town, made perfectly!! We've had the grape leaves, lebni, hummus, baba ghanoush, beef kabobs, chicken kabobs, lamb chops, lentils soup, chicken soup, mushroom soup, traditional Turkish rice pilaf, ALL Amazingly Delicious!! At the end of your meal, have the Turkish coffee with Turkish delights and baklava!! Definitely the most authentic & delicious Mediterranean/Turkish cuisine in Las Vegas! What makes the experience even better, is the friendly service!! Definitely a MUST TRY!! =)

Their food was so good! Fresh hot toasty soft pita bread. Delicious babaganoush, and beef kebab you will die for. Probably the best beef I have ever tasted. The beef donner kebab wasn't that great, it was really dry and had no flavor. 

Service: we had to ask 3 times for Turkish tea... And flag down someone for water and they were so mad about us asking for more water  that they just left the water pitcher on our table LOL they also brought out my boyfriends food first which was awkward because mine didn't come out until 8 minutes after. No one asked us how our food was, we were never checked on, and our waitress was no where to be found. Amazing food, terrible service. The food also took 45 minutes to come out WTF? I was probably be just ordering take out from them than dining in.

I've been wanting to try this place since we pass it often to and from work. 

While it is labeled as a Mediterranean fare, it seems to be Turkish.

Babaganoush was pretty decent. It was rather creamy so if you like a creamier dip then this might be for you. 

Entree meals came with a salad and that came out first in its own bowl. The serving was generous and I like the simple lemon and fresh herbs that make the vinaigrette. 

Chicken adana kabob had good flavor and texture. Beef kofta kebob could have been cooked less as it was slightly dry though. There was a side of a ezme sauce which is a tomato pepper salsa of sorts, grilled pepper and tomato, onion slices and a few triangles of pita bread. You get a choice of rice or fries and we got one of each which were both good. Everything was simple fare, but solid. 

The baklava was really good. Real buttery, nice syrup and light on spices and served warm. Currently theres a yelp check in for a free square. 

Service was friendly. At first we sat around for a long while as the server got tied up on the phone, but after we were checked on in a timely manner. Then a new server started helping and she was super personable as well.  

I will be back. It was really reasonably priced, fresh tasting and good portions.

This place has the best kabob in town!. 
Both the beef and chicken are super flavorful, tender and juicy. I always substitute rice with fries as this is my personal preference... Their fries are absolutely delicious:  crispy and fresh and well seasoned. 
Service has always been consistent. We never had the slow experience that other reviewers mentioned. 
Since we discovered this little treasure we eat here once a week. They always serve complimentary Turkish tea after dinner. It is very cute :)
This is my favorite Mediterranean place in Las Vegas. The lamb kabobs and chai are exquisite. The staff is friendly. They do not mind you lingering over a final cup of chai or your baklava.

Ate here about 12 noon on Sat/16 May:
- Used my Groupon with no issues.
- Lilly, the hostess and waitress, was great.
- Had the Combo Kebab Plate and the Lamb Chops Plate.  I declined the Jasmine rice or french fry options so Lilly offered to make mine double-salads (ie  more salad in lieu of the rice/fries), which was perfect.  I enjoyed the salads and the chicken kebab portion was good.  I loved the beef & lamb kebab portions and the lamb chops.  I don't know how those meats were so tender (via food supplier and/or cooking methods) and they were delicious.  
- Lilly kept my ice water (free) and Diet Coke ($2 and free refills) topped off and checked on me even when two lunch parties (a couple and a group of 5) arrived to the restaurant.  Place was empty when I first got there at noon, but they had tons of reservations for that night.
- Place is nice, wood(looking) flooring, table linen, cool table lighting mini-chandeliers(?), etc.  Bonus: at the end of my meal I got a free cup of Turkish hot tea.  Unsweetened, exactly the way I like my tea.
- Looking forward to coming back.

My favorite place to go to for lunch!!! They have a great selection for lunch specials for only $9.95!!! You get to choose a starter dish, an entree, dessert and soda for that price!!! Definitely can't beat that. 

My favorite thing to order from here is their chicken Adana. It is so delicious! I love the rice that comes with their dishes and especially the jalapeño. I always ask for extra. Their baklava is amazing as well!!!

Very good homey Turkish meal. I had Karniyarik (eggplant with ground meat) and my lady had Manti (homemade dumpling like ravioli with meat). Both very well balanced, very moderate portions in a good way while still plenty to eat. For starters we had Falafel and Sarma (stuffed grape leaves). Falafel was a touch well done on the outside but very soft on the inside, and not overly salty as it can be. Baklava and Turkish tea was a great conclusion to this very inexpensive yet delicious meal. We will be back!
One of the best HALAL places i ever ate in vegas, people here are so welcoming, Experience is amazing. I totally recommend it.
Excellent customer service. The waiter was nice and helpful in explaining dishes. The food was deciduous great price great portions. Meet the owner Jessica super nice!
Amazing traditional Turkish food. Very friendly and smiling face people. Thank you guys.

I love dining here when I'm in the mood for Turkish. The food is really good and so is the service. Been here a few times and have tried a few dishes. With some it's a hit or a miss but overall the food is good.

Maza is a casual Turkish Mediterranean place with indoor seating. Our overall experience was an extremely long wait, 45 minutes, with mediocre food lacking flavor. The unfiltered city water had more flavor than the food - even though the water should not have flavor! Time to change that water filter.

The ambience is loud even though it was not very busy. The restrooms were clean and open.

Appetizer:
Warm Pita Bread and Hummus was very good.

Main Dish

Beef Doner Kebab - mediocre and very lacking of flavor. The rce was fantastic. Salad was filled with mostly hard stems and very little lettuce leaves.

Kofte Kebab - We found out 15 minutes after ordering that they ran out.

Switched to Chicken Shawarma - very disappointing and lacking of flavor.

After the long wait, we skipped any additional drinks and desserts.

Service was friendly, but the lack of hostess and seat yourself only added to the confusion - we had trouble finding a clean table and then waited 10 minutes before we were greeted at the table. 

At our departure, our server apologized for the poor service, long wait, and bad food experience, but made no efforts to fix the issue.
It is surprising that this restaurant has such high ratings.
This place is amazing! The food is fantastic and very authentic. The service is really fast and the wait staff is friendly.

Great place.   Awesome food  try Adana kabob 
And appetizer platter.  Service was really good as well.

food are so delicious. we ordered soup then doner kabab and combo shish kabab. 
but shish kabab were awesome.i definitely suggested shish kabab. only problem is servise so slow.

yemekleri cok guzeldi. corba, doner ve karisik sis kebab siparis ettik. fakat kesinlikle sis kebabi harikaydi. tek eksik yani servis suresi cok uzun.

very pleasantly surprised by this place .
we had a restaurant.com  coupon and ordered the chicken kabob and chicken adana combo  9.95 $   and rack of lamb  16.95  $ .
the food came with   side salad , fries or  rice,  a grilled tomato and pepper, and pita bread. 
all the meats were so tender and nicely seasoned. the food was tasty and plentiful. as a  nice addition , the restaurant had a  live  singer on stage who sang and played nice music.
all the waitstaff were very nice and at the end of our meal , we got hot tea on the house.

We ordered the appetizer sampler, lamp chops, mediterranean salad and a gyro. All of the items were fresh, perfect prepared and delicious!!! Also love the attentive service from the staff. 

I normally hate Mediterranean food but I have to say this place changed my mind!!! It's probably the best Mediterranean restaurant I've been to in this city.

We went tonight with another couple and had a Groupon for two. We supplemented our meal for two with a delicious salad and incredible fries - more than enough for the 4 of us. The food was AMAZING, the portions generous, and the staff were so incredibly friendly. They were swamped and the staff was limited, but they made sure we had what we needed. Will definitely return!
It's the only Turkish restaurant in town. Enjoy their food often. Friendly staff and clean restaurant.

my husband ordered a combo plate that should have come with steak, lamb, and chicken. When it arrived at our house via delivery, there was no lamb in his meal and both of our plates were missing hummus. But, our delivery guy was really nice, the food was delicious and i loooove fresh pita.

I don't like the bait and switch game. 

My office ordered lunch from Maza previously. We were accessed a nominal delivery fee as expected.

However on our most recent order we were given our total. When the delivery driver arrives we are given a different total. The higher total is due to an additional delivery charge because the driver said "we are far" 

You were given the address on the phone. At that point if you feel we are too far (although it's never been in previous orders) then say that on the phone. You don't just take on additional funds without ever disclosing it.

If we aren't in your normal delivery area then why did you bring your menus to our office complex to begin with. Disclose this on your menu so consumers are aware. Verbally say it in the phone when taking our orders...

Our company will just take our daily business elsewhere..

My family and I visited this restaurant several times during Ramadan for their Ramadan special. It was 4-course meal with bottled water, (plus dates to break fast!), and it was a phenomenal deal at $15/pp. The food was served pretty quickly, and the bread is always piping hot, and makes a perfect accompaniment with their lentil soup. 

We make a point to visit this restaurant regularly for tasty kebab and other Turkish specialties. Don't miss out on the kunefe for dessert!

So, where are all you people?  We just discovered this gem yesterday after reading of it in Yelp, as well as its advertising.  At 5:00 it was about empty and were told it's just a few months old.  I ordered the chicken kabobs which incl. a wonderful full salad, perfect rice, grilled tomato & pita bread ($9.99).  The chicken (& lots of it) was pure melt-in-your-mouth, with just the right herbs.  My partner had the beef Shawarma sandwich which he raved about & which incl. a real variety of goodies, accompanied by a huge plate of non-greasy French fries.  The order of Baba Ghanoush was the best I've had in this town & smoky as it should be.

Maza is a Turkish restaurant & playing THEIR music!  What a change & how terrific the sounds.  Our server, Leila, was most charming & efficient.  We are now making this our weekly stop & I can't wait to try the lentil soup, Baklava, & lots of specialties-- all for a song.    Let's  put Maza on the map of  MUST DINING & fill it up enough for their live music to come.

K I K I

We were here for lunch one day and really enjoyed it. I had some kind of steak with pita and tzitiki all of it was delicious! I will be back and I would highly recommend it. The only thing that grossed me out was a dead cockroach on the floor in the bathroom.

Ordered an appetizer and two dinner entrees. Very good food, attentive and friendly waiter, price was good for the quality and quantity of food, good dining atmosphere and definitely a good place to go out on a dinner date. Good location and decent parking. All in all I dont have any complaints and would definitely come back. Thank you!

The food was really good . We ordered beef sandwiches and Turkish skender which is was the best I loved the food the Service was. Excellent. Just needs to smile a little bit lol but everything was wonderful the best Turkish food in Vegas..

We went for a casual lunch, and found this great place to eat. This is a Turkish restaurant, nice place, relaxed atmosphere. Service is good, people are friendly and the food is amazing. They have many types of Turkish pizzas, and all kind of kabobs, Shawarma and lamb chops. I suggest you try as many dishes as you can from the menu, Great parking, great place for intimate dinner and with groups. I go there again.

The Food is GREAT, the price is Fair. The waiter Kosta is so nice and professional 
Great place!!

I have learned to love this place. Seventh visits for March and every time had been a delightful experience.

The food is always good quality and great prices. Doesn't take long to order or get your meal.

A huge variety of healthy options.

Excellent and friendly service.

Good ambiance with plenty of sitting.

Great lunch specials before 3pm

Take out is available

All my family and friends have enjoyed this restaurant.

Teresa and Anna are simply amazing! What a team!! They convinced me to try the dessert and I'm so thankful for their recommendation. They are a big reason I enjoy lunch here.

Thank you MAZA and the staff for a wonderful experience. 

My family, friends and I love your service and tasty food. 

Keep up the great job!!

I ran into the Maza Mediterranean Grill Lounge just by either accident or divine intervention. I've never heard of the restaurant before but I  was in the area because I'd just gone to church at the
 St. Joseph husband of Mary Catholic Church nearby.
I have a chicken shawarma wrap which was phenomenal. The chicken was marinated 6 hours and it was artfully presented with lettuce and tomato. I chose the chopped salad with cucumber and tomato and pickle cabbage, rather than the french fries or the rice- and I'm so happy I did. Everything  was out of this world. 

Camille the owner was so friendly, you'll feel like you're at home.
 Many of the restaurant selections are very healthy. I will return over and over again.

Paulette Motzko, Food Writer

Amazing food and really nice service.

You cannot find such high quality Mediterranean food easily. 

Iskender and beyti are especially deliciuos with a kunefe as desert at the end.
This place is amazing. Hand down the best Mediterranean food. Everything we order came out really good. The only bad I have to say about this place is waiting for the food to come takes too long.

Update: My wait time extended up to 43 minutes and if i hadn't asked the only person to ever check on me for a refund had they put my order together. After another 5 minutes of waiting, i finally got my order and the guy told me they had added a complimentary dessert and they won't be charging me the gratuity that i initially added to my bill. He also informed me that it took that long for the order to prepare because they were also preparing for a very large banquet(it would've been nice if they told me that from the get go). As far as the food go, I gave it a 3-star overall. Portions are plenty on all the orders, and they all tasted great. I would've rated this place higher if not for the long wait. Came in and the place is empty. I ordered a take out and was told wait time is about 20 minutes( i was the only customer). I'm typing this review after 38 minutes sitting in the front and still no sign of my food being ready. I ordered 2 chicken shawarma and 2 chicken adana and a knefe. I will update this review if food is worth the wait.

Possibly one of the worst outing experience I have endured. The food was mediocre, nothing special to rave about. The falafels were horrible and their tahini sauce is straight out of a can. Nothing authentic about that. The rest of the food we ordered was edible but again nothing special. The worst part of the evening was the service at this place. Our waitress spoke very little English, nothing wrong with that unless they assume a plate of kabob was ordered with a kafta plate. When I kindly said I only ordered a kafta plate, I was scolded by her and the unprofessional manager that is running this place. Never again will I step foot at meza grille. It's advertised under a different light than what it really is. Avoid this place unless you enjoy being talked down to while eating cardboard falafels.
Combo chicken & beef.... Food was flavorful but something was missing I don't know what it is????  I got it the portion was wayyyy to small for the price.
The Mediterranean Grilled Sea Bass, beef doner, kenufe are delicious!! Can't wait to go back & try more!!

What a great place! I loved the atmosphere, service, and the cuisine. The fully pictured menu makes your mouth water and the mood is set to dine and dance at the same time. Thank you Ms. Anna for being so professional and delightful. Everyone should stop in and enjoy!

I've been here twice now for lunch. Ordered the lentil soup and Mediterranean salad the first time and the Greek salad with chicken the next. Others in my party ordered the chicken kebob lunch specials and a gyro and they looked fantastic. 

The lentil soup is different than what I'm used to (more blended consistency) but flavor was great. Both times the salads were lovely - fresh and flavorful. The herb balance with the Mediterranean salad was a standout. Chicken was tender and had good spice blends on it. I think probably the worst thing was the pita. Both times it was thin and dry, maybe over-warmed? Hummus didn't have as strong of a flavor as I'm used to, but maybe I'm just used to over-salted store bought stuff. 

Service was great both times. Wait staff is friendly and knowledgeable about most items on the menu. It's not THE best Mediterranean I've had, but it's certainly the best within a mile or two from my work. I'll be back. The quality and experience is worth the (reasonable) price.

Came here with a friend, even though on the occasion that I venture out to eat at a restaurant, I always have something else that I will eat besides Mediterranean/Turkish food. It's not that I don't like it, but...

Anyway, I think that this is the best of it's kind restaurant that I have ever eaten at. The Hummus, Falafal and Baba Ganoush (the kind w/yogurt) were all quite tasty. We both had the beef kabob which was cooked to order, flavorful and quite tender (no gristle), and the rice pilaf had a a subtle yet quite buttery flavor.

The service was good (nothing to complain about), food was great - 4.6 Stars for what it is. Don't know about other Med Food in the area, so I don't know if it was cheaper, average, a bit pricier, etc.

Also, $10 lunch special...

I ordered delivery from here today and it was amazing. Both my husband and I ordered the gyro. They were huge and delicious. I could only eat about half, so I'll have a nice midnight snack later! Everything was fresh and the delivery was fast. Will definitely order again.
Excellent food and service. I had the Kotfe kebab and they were delicious !! Definitely a repeat.

I have been here many times.  Love this place.  Never, ever had less than impeccable food and service.  Everything is amazing.  It is hard to make a decision. I want one of everything and usually get 2 or 3 things and take home just so that I can have a little bit of it all.  You must try the Knaufe (spelled a few ways) the best in the US so far.  Including NYC.  Just wished they had a Henderson location.  I love Turkish food and I do not know of another Turkish restaurant in LV and just glad that this place has great food, so that I get my fix.

Fantastic service and delicious food.
I ordered lunch for 27 people--Chicken and beef kabob, rice, large salad, hummus and tzatziki sauce, and a large tray of falafel. 
Everyone loved the meal.

Lunch special was pretty worth it for $9.95 comes with drinks and dessert plus the main entree. The only problem it's a small portion for the beef it's pretty much equivalent to one strip. Overall customer service is friendly and the restaurant is very clean.

This establishment is very clean and cute inside. The staff is attentive and friendly. 
The food was good, I got a shawarma and my husband got kabobs.  I prefer a shawarma sandwich on a pita with fresh ingredients. The lettuce was prepackaged lettuce. It would have been better if it had fresh cut lettuce and tomatoes, with a yogurt cucumber sauce. 
The kabobs could have more flavorful. 
All the chicken was  moist just missing more flavor. The pita bread was good, I can't say it was freshly made or prepackaged bread. 
Over all it wasn't horrible, and the staff being so nice would be the k my reason we would come
Back.

Nice to have good Turkish food in Las Vegas.  Good prices and service here.  I like the lamb stew over pureed eggplant, the shish kabobs and the signature maza.  Family friendly ambiance w/entertainment.  Good Greek food too.  Near The Source dispensary.  Portions are generous.  Good bar.
I had the seafood kabob. It was very tasty salmon and shrimp. I also particularly liked the rice which had some little pasta throughout it. Good quality food - I recommend it.

Not very impressed. First, it took a while to be seated. Then it took a while to get my order placed. Mind you, the place wasn't very busy. They didn't refill my water or check on me at all. It took a while to be able to alert the server that I would like my check. In fact, the only thing they were fast about was picking up the bill once I signed, which is bad form.

As for the food, well, good food can at least partially redeem lackluster service. This was not particularly good food. At $14 for the Doner plate, considering the average quality of the product, it is about $4 overpriced. I have had considerably better versions of the same dish. The cabbage side was ok, but the salad looked unappealing with non-fresh lettuce etc.

So, definitely thumbs down. Way down. Almost one star down. Very disappointed.
Went in to do some maintenance work and end up buying a meal 1st time trying this type of food and loved it..

Wandered aimlessly into the booth during the Chinese new year festival, ordered the beef shawarma.... what a disappointment. flavourless, no traditional spices used(or any for that matter), somebody is way off their game or trying to convince a fresh audience what mediterranean food suppose to taste like. quite a shame to say the least.

THE SERVICE IS TERRIBLE!!!!!!!!!The food is good. Ordered few times online (GrubHub). The delivery guy asked me to order over the phone. Just called to place an order and found out that delivery will be $40. Also, the don't really pay attention to order details. I requested some changes to dish( because of the allergy) but they didn't change it!!!!!!!

I was pleased with my experience here.  The food is good, it is priced well, and the service is good.  Honestly, the baba ghanoush is probably some of the best I've ever had, but the hummus was less than fantastic.  However, the rest of the food more than made ip for it.

Our waitress, whose name escapes me, was very attentive and gave good recommendations for us.  

I had the chicken shawurma with fries.  Everything was hot and fresh.  As mentioned by other reviewers, the french fries are fantastic, hot, crispy, and seasoned to perfection.

We ate ourselves sick.  Definitely going to return.

I love the food, I ordered once, I just went again, and I'm going to keep coming back for more! 
I order take-out and they're always prompt to bring you your food as quickly as possible. A note: the hummus is great but they used not give you extra pita to eat it with, but once it was brought to their attention, your delicious hummus now comes with a hot bundle of pita bread!
Again, will continue to return, great place, great food!

This place is about the only place that makes their babaganoush on the chunky side. At most places it comes out looking just like hummus...and it's not very good. Theirs could be better but it's still good as were the rest of the items on the Maza sampler (+hummus, tabouleh, & sarma). 

We also ended up with the Seafood Kabob (we tried to cancel this & swap for the Maza sampler but the waitress cancelled our other order). Which was just as well because it was surprisingly good. The shrimp was well cooked and seasoned and tasted great with this (I think) tomato based sauce). The salmon, which I'm sure was Altantic farmed, actually tasted pretty salmony which is hardly ever the case with farmed raised salmon because it's awful. 

I don't recommend the Turkish coffee. Despite waiting for the grinds to settle some fine pieces remained suspended so it always tasted a little gritty and wasn't very strong. 

I looks like they've got a stage and some sweet light action so I'm not sure if this place blows up at night. We went for lunch at 11:30 on a Saturday and we were the only people in there until another couple eventually came along.

I love this place. All of the eggplant dishes are delicious. So are the kabobs. The food comes out hot and fresh. I love this place. The Kings Delight is my favorite (I think that's why it's called) .

Very poor customer service. Their manager needs to work better on their staff. Otherwise this place will lose their customers.  the lady upfront is very rude. 
Food is delicious, price is reasonable.

Came here for the first time for my sisters birthday. Never had Turkish food but had Greek food they are similar. The food was super good. We got chicken and beef kababs. The chicken was very good and tasteful. The beef was like grilled steak so juicy and delicious. I will defiantly come back to this place!

I'm not sure if I came on an off night or what... I came because of a groupon deal I purchased. I arrived on a week night about 530 pm and the place was pretty empty.  There were 2 other tables filled besides mine. I was excited to try a new Mediterranean place because I enjoy their food however my experience here was pretty lacking.  I got the chicken shwarma wrap and it had more cabbage/lettuce than chicken. It was very bland tasting. Among other things we ordered, everything was ok or pretty bad in flavor. I'm not picky when it comes to food, so that should give you an idea.

Came by before my class because it was nearby and because I was craving Tzaziki.
I couldn't even take a decent picture of that because I dug in to it right away. It came with warm pita. So good!
Besides that, I ordered a Chicken Greek Salad. For the price, I'll say they are generous with their portions. Can't complain there! It was good, just wished there were more salad than veggies. I'll probably be back again to try some more menu options!

I would give them 2 stars at best. I ordered through delivered dish online and they got almost everything wrong. I ordered the cheese plate and there were NO nuts, NO fruit, NO crackers and only the feta cheese.. I do not even know what to say to that. That is just pure laziness and expecting a customer who ordered out not to notice? There was no gouda or english cheddar and it was filled with green onion and what looked like parsley... That is NOT what is listed on your menu. The chicken kabob was ok, but they served it with rice instead of the fries I asked for. And it is not really a kabob, it is more like ground chicken mashed into the shape of a kabob. I was excited to try their cuisine, but I should have known what to expect after reading all the other bad reviews. If you are going to try this place I suggest trying dine in, maybe the service and food will be better? 

It tasted all right, but if you can not get one simple order for one person right, then you must not be very organized.
Amazing and fresh! Baba Ghanoush and Sarma were amazing! We will definitely be back! Oh and the Turkish coffee is on point!

This place was not what I was expecting. Did not have Skordalia, saganaki...what Greek restaurant doesn't have these dishes!! Salad included with dinner had no substance and dressing tasted out of a bottle even though they said it was homemade.  Not even a Greek salad!

Great food for an affordable price. Very authentic and incredibly tasty. I had beef shawarma and it was awesome. Also try the Turkish coffee, traditional and very good. A little bit of Turkey in Las Vegas!

This is my favorite new Mediterranean restaurant.  The food was excellent, the prices are very reasonable, and the service was great!  I had the Maza Beyti Kebab & it was awesome!  The hummus was also very good.  My wife & I will definitely be going back soon to try more of the menu.
I had have so many dinner here. Always fresh and tasty. Today, the food disappointed me so much... One tomato was rotten.... Tasted terribly. I guess, I will not come back...
